results.description:
Tired of going to MeetUp events and trying to act cool at some random hipster bar? Well, act cool no more, my friends! If you are queer and not afraid to let your inner dork hang out, this group is for you.  We meet pretty regularly at a fun bar in Chelsea to play Cards Against Humanity, Head's Up, Jenga, and other games. Other potential activities include theater, stand-up comedy events, trivia, dinners and cocktail hours, movie night, karaoke, etc.   We're a pretty diverse and welcoming group, more interested in just having FUN and relaxing, rather than "networking."  You can also follow our Facebook page (search for Gay/Lesbian Nerds in the City).

To maintain the original intention of the group, please respect a few ground rules: (1) If you want to join the group, please include an actual picture of yourself in your profile and answer the group questions.  The point of a photo isn't to judge your hairdo or fashion choices, but to help the group recognize you at events.  The point of the questions is to get to know you a little bit.   (2) Please keep your RSVPs updated.  If your plans change and you can't make it, let us know.  If you have a habit of RSVPing and flaking with less than 24 notice, you may be dropped from the group.  This keeps it fair when we have limited spots to events.
results.name: Gay/Lesbian Nerds in the City

results.description:
The purpose of the Young Adult Initiative is to partner with a variety of organizations to plan social activities that connect young adults with and without disabilities together. Our events are open to any young adult that has a disability, knows someone with a disability or is supportive of people with disabilities. So its pretty much open to anyone!! 

Each event will start off with a variety of team building activities. This will provide an opportunity for our members to work together in a group setting to solve a problem or accomplish a task. We will have facilitators to help young adults with autism and social disorders interact with everyone else and to ensure that they are participating in the team building activities. Anyone can be a facilitator and we are looking for people are interested!!

After our team building activities we will have an interactive social activity to build on the relationships and capitalize on the confidence that our members developed during the team building activities. Many members of our group may be intimidated by social events that are unstructured and don’t involve an activity. We believe that individuals, in particular those who have social disorders are more likely to interact with others when they are involved in an activity that they enjoy and are good at. We therefore intend on including a wide variety of activities so there is something for everyone to enjoy. 


Some of our activities and team builders may include:

• Capture the flag 

• Team BBQ/Cookoff 

• Organizing a scavenger or treasure hunt 

• Creating a superbowl commercial or short film 

• Creating our own board game 

• Organizing a themed dance party

• Bowling 

• Egg Drop

• Amoeba Tag 

• Theatre Improv Games


We will have a planning committee that is open to all of our members that want to be more involved. The planning committee will determine and plan the specific events that we will hold, help us with fundraising, networking and marketing. Once we receive adequate funding we will make all events free of charge and provide free transportation.
results.name: New Brunswick Young Adult Initiative

results.description:
Kizomba/Semba Classes & Events by David Campos & Guida Rei in NEWARK, NEW JERSEY AREA

☞ What is Kizomba – The Origin

Kizomba is a breath whose rhythm is a beating heart, and where the perfect connection between two dancers gives birth to harmony, exaltation of senses and sensuality" D. Campos

Kizomba (a word meaning "Party" in angola ) takes its origin from the Angolan dance Semba, which is also the origin of the Brazilian Samba.

It appeared at the end of 70’s – 80’s, while the young Angolans, although very attached to their traditional dance,sought a new musical identity, and finally found their inspiration and new voice at a concert given by Kassav, a famous French Caribbean Zouk band. Kizomba was born out of this new generation’s desire to bring a touch of sensuality and sweetness to their national Semba.

The influence of the Angolan Kizomba soon spread to all the African Lusophone countries such as Guinea Bisau, Cape Verde, Mozambique. From there the dance quickly found its ticket to Europe via Portugal, where it further developed, by all these Artists, teachers, choregraphers coming from
these Luso-African countries.

As it rapidly gained popularity, Portugal exported Kizomba to various countries in Europe such as France, Spain, Poland, Belgium, Danemark and England. Today it is rare to find a Latin dance party without Kizomba represented, as well as salsa or bachata.

This "African Tango Zouk", also called "Tango Lusophone" continues to conquer a growing audience of passionate dancers, eager for beauty of gesture and sensuality, but also the indispensable complexity of exchange and trust present in each motions of Kizomba.

This young dance of barely thirty years is booming today, and constantly evolving.

"Kizomba is a tribute to sensuality, an ode to love and sharing. A moment when the woman's beauty, enhanced by her partner, must embody all its essence. " D. Campos

Be the pioneers here in the U.S. of a dance that will become soon a must for your dancing nightlife !!!
results.name: kizomba/semba - Newark, New Jersey

results.description: In the US, 30% of all hospital births end up in cesarian section. For the rest of the developed world, that number is 7%. Unfortunately, the reason for this difference is primarily due to the profit motives and time constraints that drive the medical industrial complex. Often, when "mothers to be" enter hospitals to deliver, they are unaware of their options and put blind faith in the hands of the medical system. This can result in mothers being lead down a path that may not be in their best interest. We intend to educate, empower, and inform "mothers to be" on their options for giving birth, with a focus on natural childbirth. This includes water births, at home births, midwife and doula assisted births, hospital and birthing center births etc.

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Group Tuesdays from 7:00 to 8:30 PM The serene and peaceful waterside setting of Wainwright House provides a wonderful environment to study the Course. A Course in Miracles is a complete self-study spiritual thought system based on universal spiritual themes. Our group meets to read and discuss the principles that make up the Daily Lessons, the Text, and the Manual for Teachers. For the purpose of shared reading, we recommend that members bring the book titled, A Course in Miracles, Published by the Foundation for Inner Peace, Combined Volume.

 The Course does not aim at teaching the meaning of love, for that is beyond what can be taught. It does aim, however, at removing the blocks to the awareness of love's presence, which is your natural inheritance. This course can therefore be summed up very simply in this way: Nothing real can be threatened. Nothing unreal exists. Herein lies the peace of God.

 All are welcome to join us in this gentle and relaxed setting of learners.$5 donation for room. For more information, please contact acimgroup@yahoo.com Wainwright House is located at 260 Stuyvesant Ave, Rye NY (914)967-6080
results.name: A Course in Miracles at Wainwright House, Rye NY

The "Three E's" of corporate entertainment: Effective, Enjoyable, and (last but not least)... EXPENSIVE. Companies spend thousands of dollars to help grow their businesses by taking clients to sporting events. While these types of interactions can have immense benefits for all involved, they come at a very steep price.

Luckily, there's IN THE GAME BUSINESS NETWORKING, which provides access to full-service networking and corporate entertainment for LESS than it costs just to buy a ticket to the game!.

A typical In The Game evening involves:

- 90 minutes high-level networking before a game at a location convenient to the arena or stadium, where you'll make business connections that are sure to payoff; drinks and hors d'oeuvres included.

- A ticket to the game in an attractive seat location.

- Access to the upscale amenities in the venue, such as private clubs and luxury suites, where you'll have the chance for further networking.

- Door prizes and other promotions offered throughout the evening.

For anyone who values the opportunity to grow their business amongst dozens of like-minded business people, in a truly unique and exciting way, then IN THE GAME BUSINESS NETWORKING is an ideal fit!
results.name: In The Game Business Networking

Topics covered in our workshops include:
* How much money do I need to buy a home in NYC?
* Mortgage payment versus rent - similarities/differences; pros/cons
* Bank criteria for loan applicants
* Down payment assistance (for eligible purchasers)

results.description:
Love to sing? Let's do it A Cappella! This group, led by a cappella guru Ed Cohn, will be in the Circle Singing format developed by legendary vocalist Bobby McFerrin and his disciples.

Circle Singing is a guided improvisational group singing endeavor. Facilitator Ed Cohn will improvise parts on the spot to be be sung by the group. The result is instant gratification of harmony and rhythm and the magic it creates. There are no lyrics to learn, but rather simple syllables that shape the sound. Ed will lead a number of various singing "games" that each focus on different aspects of singing a cappella - tone, harmony, pitch and rhythm. No one will be asked to sing alone or to solo, but there will opportunity for those who are so inclined.

This Meetup is open to the general public of all ages. Ed requests that you have some prior experience singing or at least a modicum of ability as a cappella singing can be challenging.

Ed brings a wealth of experience to his events. He was an early pioneer in the world of contemporary a cappella having performed and recorded extensively with his multi-award winning a cappella quartet, The EDLOS. Ed, besides having conducted community choruses and a cappella workshops,  is also a voice teacher and vocal coach with over 20 years experience and teaches lessons privately.

results.description:
For Creative Educators:   
A new and exciting poetry workshop series for teachers and others who are interested in U.S. education is starting up! Background: This past spring I was fortunate enough to serve as a teaching assistant for the extraordinary poet and distinguished professor Kimiko Hahn in a newly conceived Queens College graduate level course for NYC public school teachers. The course was specifically designed for those interested in writing poetry and short stories. It was an outstanding experience and the good results in the 14 week course were wonderful to see. I want to keep the concept alive and more: create a poetry writing community for educators that focuses on their personal experience and relationships with learning and U.S. education. Please consider giving this writing circle a try for sanity's sake as you continue to bang your head up against that imposing Common Core wall. [The first group is for beginning poets only; a second group for practicing and emerging poets to follow. Please scroll down for more details.]
 
About the DTCP workshops: 
They are designed for NYC public school teachers and others who are serious about learning to write poetry and/or microfiction and enjoy meaningful conversations along with building strong learning communities. Prior experience with poetry is not needed: just having a strong interest and willingness to write regularly will do. Indeed, anyone who has never considered writing poetry at all for whatever reason(s) is welcomed. These workshops are intended to be low-pressure participant-centered and very supportive. I'm looking for sincere and kind individuals who will take an interest in the learning and well-being of others as well as their own. Using selected readings and facilitated dialogue we will explore craft elements; possibilities for revisions; the individual's creative writing process; a variety of themes related to education; and other objects of knowledge. The ultimate goal is to build a supportive and inspiring community for poet educators that engenders creativity and original poetry. The locations for a projected two or more separate groups will be easily accessible in Manhattan, Brooklyn, or Queens; please participate in the location poll. There is a modest fee of $5 for each 1 ½ to 2 hour weekly session (pay in advance or as you go), with a series ending dinner, group reading, and poetry chapbook give-away for interested participants included.  

Based on early member feedback, the first scheduled group is designed for poets and writers who have little to no experience writing poetry. Mixing teachers who have taught poetry at the high school and/or college level together with less experienced writers could present problems. For the more experienced members who have responded, please send your best days/times to see about beginning another group.

So, if you are a teacher with little experience writing and teaching poetry, or simply someone interested in U.S. education and writing poetry, then this first group is for you.

If you do have experience, please stay in touch; send days and times that would work for you and we will gather a critical mass of interested participants to start a group for more experienced poets and writers.

Please let me know if you have any questions.
    
About the organizer: Andrés Castro fell in love with poetry during a curiously meandering career path that included teaching tennis; counseling and academic advisement; Met Museum of Art special security; a two-year (and change) stint with the NYC Teaching Fellows; traveling around the country on the U.S. Dept. of Education Even Start Classroom Literacy Intervention Outcome (CLIO) Study; and other jobs. He is listed in P&W's Directory of Poets and Writers and is a PEN member. While completing his undergraduate and MFA graduate work at Queens and Brooklyn (CUNY), he was instructed by Marie Ponsot, Kimiko Hahn, L.S. Asekoff, and Allen Ginsberg. After founding two now nonextant small press poetry journals, The U.S. Latino Review [1999-2002] and The Teacher's Voice [2004-2014], he is working on a Race in U.S. Education anthology (accessible for free at The Teacher’s Voice online archive) and attending the Antioch University Post-MFA Program in Creative Writing Pedagogy, with new work forthcoming in Pilgrimage. He lives with his wife in Kew Gardens, Queens; their son, daughter, and son-in-law are teachers in Queens and the U.K.
results.name: For Educators: Dialogue to Creativity & Poetry

results.description:
Are you a women, age 50 or over, with a sense of adventure and a “bucket list” of things you’d like to experience? 

Do you have a desire to connect and make new friends with like minded women our age?

Are you looking for a place to share good times doing the things you’ve always loved?

If so, you’ve come to the right place!  Baby Boomer Women Social is a group designed to foster lasting friendships among vibrant, spirited women who have a desire to partcipate in a wide range of activities that pique our interests, expand our horizons, rejuvenate our minds and bodies, and unleash our passions. 

• Discover your "inner artist" at an Art and Wine Party …

• Escape for a weekend “self-renewal” retreat  …

• Bring out your "zany side" during an afternoon of improv …

• Enjoy dinner and the theater or a lively game of BUNCO over drinks and hors d’eourves …

• Spend a rejuvenating day at the spa … 

• Learn what it’s like to dance like a Rockette … 

• Try something a little more daring like parasailing (or cheer the group on from a seat in the boat) … 

• Share your passion for Impressionism during a trip to the art museum or your love of Puccini during a night at the opera ... 

• Join us in an activity that sparks your imagination or just sounds like fun!

In the words of Eleanor Roosevelt, “The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” 

PLEASE NOTE: Baby Boomer Women Social is a friendly, supportive, fun-loving group of women that has traditionally had an "open door" policy when it comes to membership. Unfortunately, this policy was abused by some unscrupulous individuals.  We were able to obtain sufficient information to allow Meetup to identify those individuals and ban them from the site.  However, after careful consideration and at the suggestion of Meetup's Trust and Safety Team, new policies have been implemented in an effort to protect the privacy and security of our members from unwelcome and inappropriate solicitation going forward to the extent that it is possible on the Internet, and in an effort to allow all members of our group to socialize and communicate freely with one another without fear of harassment.  To that end, effective June 16, 2015, women who are interested in joining our group must first request to become a member and be approved before gaining access to our site. When you request to become a member of Baby Boomer Women Social, you will simply be asked to answer a few brief questions and upload an appropriate photo of yourself. Photos of animals, flowers, signs, "stock photos", portions of your body (i.e., your eye) or photos that mask your face and/or make it impossible to identify you are not considered appropriate. Regretfully, any request that fails to provide appropriate answers and an appropriate photo will be denied. 

     This is by no means an indication that Baby Boomer Women Social is a "cliquish" group. Indeed, we welcome new members and we hope that these new policies will not deter you from joining us!
results.name: Baby Boomer Women Social: To Enrich the Midlife Journey

results.description:
Welcome to Tinkergarten Manhattan! 

Do you wonder if the unbridled, outdoor play that used to be part of the fabric of growing up has been lost? At Tinkergarten, we know that is where true learning happens, so we’re here to bring it back!

As a member of this group, you'll be invited to join us for free trial classes and special events in Central Park, and other parts of the city. You'll meet other parents who believe in learning through play and outdoor adventure. We'll also share outdoor DIY activity ideas, and let you know about new classes  starting in your area.

Those who have been members for a while will note that we began as Tinkergarten Central Park - UWS & UES.  We intended to use the group to share outdoor DIY activity ideas, and inform people about upcoming classes, including free events in Central Park for UWS and UES families (and those willing to travel). 

The good news? We're going to keep doing all of that -- we're just expanding our reach so we can share Tinkergarten with more kids and families, in more parts of the city we love.

We'd love you to join our community. Then, take your kids outside and play!

To get ideas for fun outdoor activities: http://www.tinkergarten.com

If you're interested in leading classes at your community: http://tinkergarten.com/leader/

To get in touch, email kate@tinkergarten.com

results.description:
Anyone who follows the daily happenings of technology knows that it’s fascinating and debate inducing. The constant headlines of change and disruption is enough to leave anyone with more questions than answers.

While its natural to internalize and apply ones thinking to his/her own interests, experts agree that it's also important to understand a view that is larger than that which transcends our own interests. The Lower Manhattan Tech MeetUp is an event where we encourage a community of entrepreneurs, investors and professional service providers, among others, in New York City to learn, think about and have dialogue on technology’s future impact on society. How will driverless cars affect the insurance industry? Is space exploration a needed component to our nations future? Is there such thing as privacy?

In order to reach an understanding, the Lower Manhattan Tech MeetUp invites our country’s foremost experts to tackle these topics. But we also need YOU, to bring your background and point of view. This MeetUp is not meant to answer all the questions and solidify the solutions, rather its purpose is to foster the conversations and facilitate discussions around the topics.

If you're an entrepreneur, tech professional, or anyone genuinely interested how technology will affect society, this MeetUp is an opportunity to listen and learn, exchange ideas and network with liked-minded individuals.

We hope you will join us. Stay tuned for our first monthly meetup happening soon!
results.name: Lower Manhattan Tech MeetUp

Or have a cozy movie night watching Sherlock Holmes movie interpretations? results.description: Hi everyone! I'm Francesca - a 45 year old mom living in Maplewood. As a plus-sized woman, it's harder for me to find a network of like-minded women who come across the same challenges as I do in life... everything from shopping for clothes, to fitting in movie theater seats, to exercise. Resources for larger women are slim to none (pun intended!). Therefore, I want to create a network of plus sized women that are a RESOURCE FOR EACH OTHER. I want to build strong friendships, have fun with people who feel comfortable around each other, and provide an ample shoulder to lean on when times get tough. THIS GROUP IS NOT FOR BBW ADMIRERS!! This group is for plus sized women who want to do the following with each other: - shopping... at stores where clothes fit us! - fun outings... where the activity level fits our needs and abilities! - movies... with people who understand that we need a seat in between each other, and don't feel weird about it! - dinner out... without anyone looking at your plate and wondering if you should "really be eating that!" - fitness...without judgement, at a pace and level that works for each person! - FEEL FREE TO BE 100% WHO WE ARE AROUND EACH OTHER! I live in Maplewood but work in Piscataway, so meet ups will be in central & Northern NJ, as well as NYC, which I LOVE! Looking forward to meet you!

results.description:
(Please read the description below completely . Thanks) 

We're a diverse group of women of all backgrounds, races, and walks of life, who just so happen to feel more comfortable in the “cool” crowd... if you know what I mean.

I plan on keeping this group uber small, and the events even smaller, so to improve your chances of acceptance, show us your personality by answering all profile questions to the best of your ability, and by including a clear photo of yourself.

Don't let the title fool you in to thinking we're not about making bona fide friendships; hopefully friendships that go way beyond meetup.

Requirements

• Must be attractive - I'm obviously not talking super model gorgeous here. I just mean cute and well put together. Don't be intimated to join. This is a sisterhood!

• Must upload clear, close, and recent photo of yourself as well as answer all questions.  (No pics of babbling brooks or rolling hills, although, I'm a sucker for pretty landscapes.)

• Must be between the ages of 21-35ish :)

• Must be fun and outgoing. (Sorry, No wallflowers). Only POSITIVE, upbeat personalities please.

• Must be sweet, caring, and willing to form genuine friendships.

• Must not be socially awkward in a group setting. 

• Must not be self-absorbed, rude or anything else in that vein. This isn't a group for mean girls, just a group of women who truly want to form genuine relationships, whether we're hitting a club, picnicking in the park, or hanging out at one another's apartments.

• MUST BE AN ACTIVE MEMBER. The point is to actually see you. This is a small group, so inactive members will be deleted after TWO Months.

Let's just have fun in the city! Please Join.

results.description:
Visit us on FaceBook!!  - facebook.com/NJTeamDragons


Dragon Boat is a fast growing, international team sport which offers a full-body workout, competitive spirit, and a summer tan. 

Team Dragons invites all ACTIVE Guys, Women, and Teens (16+ & up).  No paddling experience is necessary to try AND LOVE this exciting, adrenaline pumping sport! 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cqqQGRZHZ2k

A dragon boat is basically a long canoe with a dragon head in the front and tail in the back. The crew consists of 20 paddlers - 10 on the left, 10 on the right, 1 drummer in the front of the boat, and 1 steersman in the back.  Most races are 200m, 500m, 1000m, or 2000 meters long.  When you have 20 people paddle in synch, the boat can move as fast as 15 MPH!


The NJ Dragon Boat Club consists of 3 types of crews to choose from:

• Team Dragons, a mixed crew competitive Racing team

• Mixed recreational team

• Team SOS Pathways, an all women breast cancer survivor team


We supply all the equipment and training. Our season starts on water from April and ends around October and usually practice 2 to 3 times a week.   This is GREAT for those weekend warriors as well!

We know everybody has a busy life, so practice is not mandatory unless you sign up for the Dragon Boat Races. We usually plan for 4 Races every season. Last year, we competed in Baltimore MD, Princeton NJ, Hartford CT and Montreal Canada with medals and trophies as return for all the hard work you commit and put in.

If you are looking for exercise and want to meet new people in a co-ed team sport environment (recreational or competitive), contact New Jersey Dragon Boat Club for more information.  Our members are from 14 years old to 65 years old.

 For more information go to facebook.com/NJTeamDragons and njdragonboat.org

Contact Team Managers Alain and Don at njteamdragons@gmail.com for more details.


Please complete and bring this WAIVER (linked) for each individual.

See ya'll dockside!
results.name: New Jersey Dragon Boat Club

results.description:
Practice capturing the depth of a human face through paint or pencil. Perhaps travel to another city/country, in order to do so. Diversity highly, HIGHLY encouraged, please.

THE GOAL: 

• Artists serious about refining portrait skills spend hours discovering and perfecting a live human face. 

• A volunteer (face) model/member holds a series of expressions/facial poses, which will be captured by photographs shared during rest periods. 

• Artists develop their skills through speed sketching, live drawing, and then long periods of refining based on memory and photographic references.  

------------------------------------  

NEEDED PER SESSION: 

•  (1) Volunteer face model (member faces welcome, cross-America locations welcome)* 

•  (1) Volunteer photographer (develop your portrait photography skills with us!)* 

•  (1) Safe, public studio space with detail-friendly lighting** 


* Please send photo (of self if volunteering as model, of work if volunteering as photographer) as application. 

** Sessions will charge $15/person if space requires a fee. In my ideal world, this space is as super free as possible. 

------------------------------------ 

Donations in general will be encouraged to thank our volunteers, or to provide for food/drinks.

In the beginning this may just be me. So if you are a member that wants to be drawn or painted, I encourage your participation.

results.description:
As a business owner or entrepreneur, are you serious about using networking to grow your business? 

Networking matters whether you want new customers, repeat business, referrals or attention of potential investors. However, it is seldom taught anywhere and consequently most networkers fail to get adequate return out of their investment in business networking meetings. Business networking is not about exchanging cards!

There are tools such as elevator pitches, one-on-ones, strategic alliances, follow ups and social media that you need to master. Whether you are a pro or a newbie, our tools help you tremendously in honing your business networking skills. Our events are quality events that help you grow into a power networker who gets real business out of networking meetings. We also strive to create a synergistic referral network for you. 

At our events you can: 

• Mingle with like minded individuals and create strong business relationships.

• Reach everyone in the meetup through elevator pitches.

• Take part in our highly successful interactive educational programs.

• Learn more about the mindset and skills of business ownership.

• Learn about and create strategic alliances.

• Become a spotlight speaker and promote your business.

About myself: I have been organizing one of the highest ranked NY Connect and Grow business networking group on meetup with 4200+ members and felt a need of a networking group which teaches people how to network. Looking forward to meet you at our next event!
results.name: NY Power Networking Group

Parents bond with their child as they learn touch, and hands-on movement techniques to support infant development.

Child'Space NYC Classes and Courses.  


To learn more about Child'Space NYC & Feldenkrais visit our page

www.childspacenyc.com

results.description:
Calling all Comedy Lovers! We've started this group for you. Every 2 weeks, we come together at Bo's Kitchen & Bar for a FREE comedy show, featuring New York's best up-and-coming standup comics and Headliners from around the country. 

For those of you who love good food as much as we do, Bo's Menu offers cuisine that is "part New Orleans, part New York, all New Invention dedicated to fresh ingredients and house-made fare." -someone who knows a lot about food. 

Past shows include Headliners like ADAM NEWMAN (Comedy Central), Sean Donnelly (The Late Show w/David Letterman), Frank Liotti (Blue Bloods/Caroline's) and more.

Maybe you're new in town and want to meet new people, maybe you've been here forever and you're sick of the ones you have. Maybe you're getting out of a terrible relationship and you need the laughs. Maybe you have Seasonal Depression and you just need a reason to get out of bed! That's your business. We don't care, we're here for you. 

Every other Monday, you can come to Bo's, where nobody knows your name (yet), and hang with us.  Send us a note and let us know you're coming- we'll post the inevitably awesome lineup a week before the show.  We can't wait to brighten up your Mondays with a ton of laughs and to meet more comedy lovers!

results.description:
What is a Freezer Meal Workshop?

- First you’ll pre-order a selection of Pantry items based on your menu selection and receive them at the workshop.  You’ll then purchase groceries from a list provided, for your meals, and bring them to the workshop.  At the workshop, you’ll assemble 4 - 10 different meals (featuring the pre-ordered Pantry items) to take home and freeze. When it’s time to thaw and cook a meal, minimal effort is needed in a skillet, microwave or oven to finish up the recipe!

Your registration order includes your Pantry items, the use my Pampered Chef® tools as you assemble your own meals, use of my kitchen and a copy of the recipes you assembled.  We’ll sample one of the finished recipes during the workshop.  

Why will I enjoy the Workshop?

- You will love going home with a week’s worth or more of meals. You will enjoy prepping your meals in a fun and social atmosphere.  There’s no messy kitchen at home to clean up!

 How many servings do the recipes provide and how much will the groceries cost?

- Each recipe serves 6-8. Grocery costs vary, but on average, groceries will cost about $40-$100 (including the freezer bags) depending on your meal plan. The cost per serving is only about $3.00. 

Your Registration Order needs to be paid in full in order to reserve your spot for a workshop.  A minimum order is required to attend a workshop ($45 for 4 meal workshops - $70 for 10 meal workshops) .  You may order a combination of pantry items and/or products to meet your minimum order. 

Preferred payment method is by credit or debit card, which you enter directly into your order, I never have the number.  Once you are registered, I will send you a shopping list for what grocery items to bring to the workshop along with other important information.
results.name: Freezer Meal Workshops & Parties w/ Pampered Chef Jasmine B

results.description:
Oneness Connecticut hosts weekly Blessing Circles and classes to initiate and support a process of awakening and growing — internally, professionally, and in relationships. Non-denominational and undogmatic, the worldwide Oneness Blessing phenomenon attracts  participants of all ages from all walks of life and beliefs (or non-beliefs) who bond over  a common desire for something more in life. 

The blessing is a brief, light laying on of hands of subtle energies transmitted by Oneness Blessing Givers that initiate a neurophysical change in the brain, declutching the mind and quieting inner chatter and divisiveness. Participants experience deep inner peace and expansiveness during the process, resulting in growing clarity, inner peace, self-acceptance, personal breakthroughs, and miracles. 

The evening includes a chakra meditation to raise kundalini (energy) and a discussion or Q&A period. During the blessing, you just sit in a chair with your eyes closed, listen to beautiful music, and receive multiple transmissions of grace. The experience is often sublime, and always tailored to exactly what it is that you need next in your life.
results.name: Oneness Connecticut Blessing Circles

results.description:
The goals of the code jam are to:

1.  A networking event where technologists can meet other colleagues and network throughout the industry.

2.  Create a new product using unknown or newer technologies.

3.  Give working technologists additional portfolio pieces to assist with their skillsets and their careers.


This "Code Jam" is a weekly (or sometimes bi-weekly) event where the members of the group collaborate and build a product known as an MVP or (Minimum Viable Product).   Each organizer may invite up to 4 additional engineers or entrepreneurs who wish to participate on an ongoing basis.  All work is voluntary as this is a professional growth and network experience for all involved. 

During the process, the team will have the ability to investigate and prototype new technologies into the solution.   Product cycles are expected to take 4-8 weeks.


Beer, lunch, dinner and snacks provided as necessary.
results.name: NYC Technology Code Jam

results.description:
Hi moms and mom-to-bes! 

Motherhood is truly transformative in every way- yoga celebrates our bodies, stills our minds and opens our hearts. Come share your yoga practice and healthy habits with your baby in a fun and supportive environment. We will practice yoga, swap recipes, and have play dates (and plan some much needed mom time!). Mommy & baby (and prenatal) yoga has so many benefits for moms: alleviates aches and pains, improves sleep, reduces stress, forms a deeper bond with your baby (whether still in the tummy or already born), and increases endurance for childbirth (this one is specifically for the soon-to-be moms!) to name a few. A happier mom results in a happier baby! :) Come meet other moms and caregivers for bonding, support and friendship! 

I am a certified yoga and meditation teacher specializing in prenatal and Mommy & Me yoga, and would love to show you how to stay strong throughout your pregnancy and after baby! 

We will have meetups for prenatal yoga as well as mommy & baby, depending on interest. Classes will be 1 hour, afterwards we can socialize and munch on yummy snacks. If members would like to host play dates, that would be wonderful too! When the weather gets warmer, we can hold sessions at the park. 


Cui's bio: http://en.gravatar.com/loveyogi1

results.description: If you live in the Hillside/Newark area and are looking for a convenient spot to practice Yoga please consider joining this group. ALL skill levels are welcome. I started this group to introduce Yoga to individuals that may find it difficult to travel to Yoga studios in other areas and at a decent cost. This class is taught by Dahlia Vertreese who remains a committed student and teacher of Kim Shand's Rethink Yoga (“RTY”) powerful Hatha Vinyasa flow. RTY is a perfect complement of cardiovascular activity with a gentle Vinyasa flow infused with spirituality. Dahlia has been teaching the Rethink Yoga style of Power Vinyasa since becoming a certified teacher in August 2014. The Rethink Yoga style combines external work (postures and breath) with internal work (cultivating a yogic lifestyle, meditation, and wisdom) creating a practice that encourages students to find their personal power. Always set with an intention of practice, Dahlia’s classes provide a thorough workout while encouraging students to reach out of their comfort zones mentally and physically. Depending on the needs and demand of the students, Dahlia is open to modifying classes towards Gentle flow, Restorative Yoga, Yoga for Men or for private instruction (additional rates apply for private lessons).  Cost: $15.00 per class.

results.description:
We are looking for members with real experience in filmmaking - all aspects of filmmaking. Whether it be through school, professional experience, or both. 

This group is about combining forces (talent) to create something really great, essentially without having to have a budget. How? There are thousands of us in NYC who are constantly seeking out opportunities to put our talents to use, and eventually be able to earn an income or make a bigger income from our skill sets. This group will serve as a network to find what and who you are looking for. Whether you want to create an outstanding showreel, submit your work into a festival, make a name for yourself, gain more experience, or even just collaborate with other artists, this group, if used correctly, will put your skills to use.

New members will be added to the LetsShootSomethingGreat database (a google drive spreadsheet in which you can edit in your information) and it will be shared with everyone. Every couple of weeks, when we have enough good scripts to select from, we will vote on our favorite. We will then organize separate "interview" Meetups where a qualified Organizer will select his crew based on these interviews and members' past work. 

If you wish to join and remain in this Meetup, please add yourself to the spreadsheet below and fill in your information.

 MEETUP SPREADSHEET

results.description:
One Acts and Snacks is a monthly gathering that celebrates new works written by up-and-coming playwrights. We are a supportive community that nurtures new art, gives voice to artists and patrons alike, and inspires even greater artistic endeavors. To do this we gather playwrights, actors and theater lovers in a cozy intimate setting and share what feeds our minds, bodies and souls. One Acts and Snacks is not a traditional play performance, but rather a semi-produced table-read. This means that every character is assigned an actor or actress, and the entire script — along with the stage directions — is read in its entirety.

Following the read-through, the audience will be able to interact directly with the playwright, asking questions and providing feedback. Socializing and networking will follow.

We may occasionally also explore previously published but lesser known scripts that lend themselves to artistic discussion between actors and audience and inspires our main values of creativity and community.
results.name: Brooklyn One Acts and Snacks- Staged Readings and Discussion

topics.name: Career Advice, Career Help, Interview Skills

results.description:
Who Are We?

Did you want to chase your dreams so that you leave everything you knew and came to the U.S.? Do you wonder how to properly set up your life and career in a foreign country? This is a group for international students and professionals alike that are looking to expand their network. All international students and professionals are welcome to join, network, and offer advice or answer questions. 

What Do We Do?

We offer information, workshops and networking events in

• For International Students

• How to establish a long term career plan?

• How to choose your major and navigate between your interests and employer needs?

• How to build your career profile in school through internships and student organizations?

• What did other successful international professional do to secure a career?

• For International Professionals

• How to merge with your team at work?

• How to ask to be on an exciting project or to ask for a raise?

• How to build your new interest and skills and apply it to work?

• How to make a career transition and what did other peer professionals do with their career?

我們是誰?

你是不是在追梦的道路上远离他乡？你是不是迷茫该如何在异国建立自己的职业和生活？ 这是一个为国际学生和在职者建立的平台。在寻找职业道路的莘莘学子们可以与在职者连接并得到有用的信息。在职者可以从其他在职者中了解别人与众不同的生活。欢迎所有国际学生和在职者加入。我们会组织聚会或是座谈会来建立联系的平台。 另外，我们在其他社交网站上会每天发布成功在职者的经历，以启发大家。

我们做什么?

对于在校留学生：1，建立长期职业规划？2，如何选择本科专业？3，如何做好在校求学期间的工作寻找 4，学哥学姐的成功案例给自己的启示

对于在美工作者：1，如何融入所在公司这个团队？2，如何与上司表述自己擅长的岗位或加工资的述求？3，如何重新发现自己新的兴趣或建立新的能力？4，如何重新选择新的职业或岗位？
results.name: International Students & Professionals Career Development

results.description: We are a small group who is involved in a very exciting music-theatre project. Also, we need to expand our horizons and we welcome participation from others. On occasion we "meetup" for events: this past month for example, attended Martha Graham Dance Co. performance—modern dance is an unusual art form-- “takes one's mind far away. ” We attend music, and theatre events, mostly off or off-off B'way, and lectures. Our last was a lecture on Feb 22, at the SVA Theatre (333 W. 23rd) on the subject of energy. Later, we meet for “coffee,” for discussion. We have endorsements from NASA scientists for a vital music discovery that we’ve turned into a play, theatre/music piece—with potential positive ramifications. This segment is called: "Translators of the Universe." The content is new to the music industry, but also includes innovative ideas for living. We meet in the West 80's or at Nola Studios on W. 54th. Prior to 12/31/14 we met at Steinway Hall, as many know the Steinwway company has moved. We convene 2-3 times a week to move our project forward. We are hoping to augment our team with people who have interest in classical music, theatre, and healthy living. We meet to exchange ideas that might enhance the project, have dinner, and involves a social meetup. I thought the MeetUp group might infuse energy into our project. Having volunteered for Musica Sacra (choral music), the U.N. and other organizations, we model our meetings to include a healthy dinner while brain-storming ideas for a national release of our passion, Breaking The Rules. The cast includes 3, but we do also need actors who can step in, and lots of participation from a committee. Our group and ideas are exciting, and hope you’ll consider joining our fun, meetups, and efforts. Every summer we go on a retreat. Last summer to Nantucket summer of ’13 the Adirondacks. I know the description does not explain everything, however, should you have interest please see our site. We hope you can join us. www.breakingtherules.com

results.description:
This is the official meetup page of Bubble Soccer NYC (http://www.bubbleballsoccernyc.com)

More fun than soccer, safer than football, cheaper than hockey, and bouncier than basketball. BubbleBall guarantees to make you spin, bounce and laugh like no other sport in history! 


What is Bubble Ball Soccer?

Bubble soccer (also known as “Boblefotball” "bubble football" "bumperz" and "bubble ball") is the brainchild of Henrik Elvestad and Johan Goldenfirst. The first game appeared on Golden Goal, a Norwegian TV show, in 2011. Since then it has rapidly spread like wildfire throughout the world and finally, Bubble Ball Soccer has landed in NYC (the tri-state area). 

To play, teams of up to ten players don typical soccer/sports clothing and put their giant bubble ball suits (loosely described as giant, inflatable hamster balls) on top. Each suit is very safe and is designed for any type of weather or outdoor arena.They have a built in backpack style harness so you can strap the balls on, and handles to allow for pain free spills, hard tackling, bumping, knocking, bouncing and rolling.

Don't worry though, you won't get a yellow card for this type of behavior. Bubble ball soccer is a full contact sport and there are no tackling fouls to be heard of. Roughhousing is actually encouraged and what makes bubble ball soccer so much fun! The balls will absorb the tackle and do what it does best, bounce back and bring you to your feet without causing you any harm, pain or injury!

So, what are the actual rules? Simple - keep the balls in bounds and score! This is a lot harder than it looks (actually it doesn't look easy at all) and as a result most games end up with only a few goals. Despite this fact, it's still a very entertaining game to watch and even more fun to play. Expect to burn up to 1000 calories, sweat, laugh, get some aggression out and experience withdrawal symptoms until your next round!
results.name: NYC Bubble Ball

results.description:
Ever wanted to be a full stack developer? We here at developer unicorns will teach you the ins and outs of full stack awesomeness. Learn - python, javascript, ruby, mobile development, hardware hacking and more!


* Who should join: 

We have three types of members: 

1)   Those trying to learn to code. 

2)  Those strong in one area (like frontend development) but looking to grow in other areas

3)  Those already strong in general (like an average full stack developer) but looking to stay current with tools in the field

  
* Why should members join: 

The central goal of Developer Unicorns is to create a group of people who keep each other abreast of the most current technologies in the world of mobile and web development.  This includes front end, backend, big data, and industry specific knowledge.  

Members should join if they want to meet other folks trying to learn more about software development, if they want to make new friends in the tech space, or if they just love learning about current technology.


* What can members expect out of the group: 

There are two types of events that our community holds regularly - lecture style talks and workshop style events.

During the lecture style talks a topic is introduced and a lecture is given.  This covers a high level overview of the topic and shows you some examples of how to use the technology being discussed.  This could be a technology stack, a design pattern, a new language, a framework, or a new piece of hardware, etc.  

During the workshop style event members are given the option to work on discrete exercises or hack on their own project using the topic discussed during the previous lecture style talk.  This way any skills are reinforced AND the members with more questions can ask the lecturer something specific.
results.name: Developer Unicorns

I have several ideas for upcoming meetups -- some will be classes where we will make several cards or a home decor item, and others will be an open house style where you can each bring your own paper crafting projects, and you can use all of my non-consumables such as punches, the Big Shot die cutting machine (and all the many dies I have), stamps, and ink.  I will provide great snacks (usually involves CHOCOLATE in one form or another) and drinks, and assist you with your creative projects.  Each class will be priced according to materials involved.
I hope you will join me and I look forward to meeting some new friends who share this hobby!

Stampingly,

Selene Ferguson

Specifically, we'll host speed dating events, singles mixers and other activities designed to enable members to meet one another for the purpose of dating and/or establishing intimate relationships.  And we'll do so by ensuring that members will be able to meet without the added pressures of feeling compelled to share contact information or expressing a lack of interest in someone.  At the end of our events, if you'd like to connect with someone you dated or met at the event, and he's interested in connecting with you, we'll forward you one another's contact information.

results.description:
We're a group of people who like practicing and building our flow of resilience together. We like to explore how we can learn from ourselves by challenging our beliefs. And! It should be also fun and easy! We work on it together in Manhattan and Brooklyn! In the park for example or at interesting venues. 

Join us if you'd like to escape your apartment, grow personally and meet some cool people!


----

1: "Again another meetup group in self improvement, ugh!"

2: "What is it that made you visit it?"

1: "That's none of your business!"

2: "That's true, luckily it is your business, haha! In this group you learn to work on your own business but we do it together. We do this with 'The I Philosophy method', it's all about talking to yourself in an empowering way....

1: "What? Talking to yourself?"



1. Observing, exploring and questioning the way we talk to ourselves is the best way to happiness we believe. And the cool thing about it is, it's a lot of fun too.

2. Experiencing together the leading role we have in our own lives..Find answers to dilemmas, how to reach certain goals.


The I Philosophy:

'Talking to yourself and getting away with it.. That's sound weird right?

But we do talk to ourselves all the time. We've got these little voices in our heads like in the new Pixar movie 'Inside out (trailer)'. Do you recognize that?


Why we are a big fan of this movie?

 [Spoiler alert]: it is great to see in the movie that Sadness is as important as Joy for the happiness of the main character..! This totally corresponds with the I Philosophy. We believe:

- Everything that exist within you has the right to because it has a function for you.


What it is, is for you to find out...Exploring both your inner motivators and thresholds are the way to happiness. 

Eva Helmond developed this pragmatic, easy and fun method to 'talk to yourself' in 2013. She moved from Amsterdam to NY, where she worked as a HR manager. She started her business as a life & business coach in 2012, and she works as a radio host and moderator. The method is for individuals and groups and she uses well trained actors.

Walk & talks: for beginners every Thursday at 7pm at Central Park
results.name: I philosophy NYC

"WE OWN" NYC

(WE OWN = Women’s Effect On the World’s Nations)

WE OWN the "RIGHT" to encourage women to live up to their full potential; full and healthy lives, rather than those limits which society has placed on them, or that, they have been conditioned to place on themselves. 

WE OWN the "RIGHT" to encourage women to learn from their mistakes, value their sense of self, love themselves, perceive the sky as their limit, and turn their dreams into reality. 

WE OWN the "RIGHT" to encourage women to exercise self-determination (ability to make choices), being aware that there are always options. 

YES!

WE OWN” "OUR" Dreams, Goals, Bodies, Abilities, Desires, Competencies, and for darn sure the “RIGHT” to make "OUR" Own Decisions, Support each other, Have fun, and Succeed in the process.

THIS IS "OUR" WORLD DAMNIT! 

Let's Leave A Footprint Where Others Can See It.

PS:

GENTLEMEN! 

WE OWN'S intent is not to exclude you from the building process. You are welcome to work with and support your Women Peers/Colleagues.

You are part of "OUR" world.

results.description:
For artists and producers in and around New York City, both full time and traveling...This meetup is created as a venue for those who are living and working hard in the fields of media, production and the performing arts to get together and NOT NETWORK :)

I repeat this is not a networking meetup. What then do we do, you might ask? :) This is a meetup to do fun social things that are within our fields but are not related to our work. If you are a television producer, join us at the ballet. If you are a ballerina, join us for a photography walking tour. Time and time again I see a huge need for those of us in the fields to get out of the office, the theatre, the studio, etc and get some fresh air and social time...I myself am guilty of this so often.

I work as both a professional ballerina and as a producer and you all know, I don't have to tell you how hard it is to make it in this town. So please leave all your egos, elevator pitches and resumes, headshots and the like at home. Come have a drink with us, see a movie, have dinner, and not talk about work :) I should clarify however, that venting, kvetching, bitching, is highly encouraged (as long as it is within reason of course.) This is a place for producers to get together with other producers and vent about stuff we can't vent to our co-workers/artists, etc about...

I recently had a huge success with a meetup called "Fun Things To Do In NYC That Makes Sense" and I would like to continue that here...

results.description: Welcome to Nichibei Toastmasters, the one and only English/Japanese bilingual Toastmasters club in New York City! All our members know that our club is the best place you can learn communication and leadership skills in both English and Japanese. We have accomplished the "Distinguished Toastmasters Club Award" 5 years in a row. This award is given by Toastmasters International to the clubs that accomplished at least 5 of its specified goals. Not only is our club effective, but it is so much fun that it’s addictive! Our membership is open to anyone who is interested in improving their public speaking skills in a culturally diverse environment. We meet in mid-town Manhattan twice a month, and in each meeting, we run two sessions; first in English and then in Japanese. However, you do not need to speak Japanese and you are very welcome to participate in the English session only. Our club provides a friendly and supportive environment where you can build up confidence with each speaking assignment. By regularly presenting a speech in front of like-minded professionals, you will soon find yourself speaking in a more relaxed and confident manner to the board of directors, to your customers or even in job interviews! Feel free to join us as a guest and see for yourself how it works. We look forward to meeting you soon!

results.description:
This fun and lively group is for everyone in the central parts of New Jersey who love film, music, theater, the arts, comedy, entertainment, and dining out!  Wanna watch fireworks blasting off the Heldrich on NY Eve with a DJ providing the music? See a classic movie like Casablanca with live musical accompaniment by the NJ Symphony Orchestra? How about a picnic in the park with a Butterfly Release on Memorial Day to honor the men and women who served our country? Or a cooking demo at RWJUH by a Top Chef with a "healthy heart" presentation? Maybe Friday night means it's just pizza and a great movie! Or a Saturday night live comedy show with dinner at the Stress Factory! Or Sunday Brunch at Rafferty's in the Spring with a walking tour through the interesting and historical little streets of downtown New Brunswick! Or a little jazz at Old Bay....

New Brunswick ROCKS!  Downtown New Brunswick and neighboring cities East Brunswick, North Brunswick, Highland Park and Somerset have blossomed into a collective mecca of the arts, from the live theater of George Street Playhouse and Crossroads Theater, to big concerts and productions at the State Theater, to local theater, to commercial moviehouses and to the International Film Festival at Rutgers, our State University, in addition to community events sponsored by RWJUH, and area cultural festivals, as well the fabulous little ethnic restaurants tucked away in our towns. We will find and explore many facets of arts and entertainment options, and design some of our own.

Did you know that at one time, years ago, New Brunswick was also then the cultural capital of central New Jersey? There were four grand RKO movie theaters in downtown New Brunswick, as well as an Opera House.  The only one that still stands is the State Theater which has been redeveloped, refurbished, and renovated to its former glory!  Also on today's Livingston Avenue "theater row" is the George Street Playhouse and the Crossroads Theater. 

Let's celebrate everything that this wonderful area has to offer... including movies, theater, comedy shows, art, music, and interesting cuisines or just casual pizza or burger nights. We'll also find "word of mouth" events and community celebrations like the New Years Eve block party with music and fireworks shot off the top of the beautiful Heldrich Hotel!
results.name: Central Jersey Arts & Entertainment!

results.description:
This group promises to be more active and diverse than the typical expat meetup group.

While we'll also have the ubiquitous expat pub gathering, ours will happen more than once every three months. More importantly, we'll have more than just pub nights. And most importantly, everyone is welcome. Canadian or not. But be warned: chances are that you'll be outnumbered by Kannucks!

On variety and frequency... We already have two weekly events posted on our schedule and have had great turnouts so far.

Join us for Tuesday Night Street Hockey!

Or come on out for Thursday Night Crokinole! If you don't know Crokinole, it's a mid-1800s Canadian table-top game, which is perhaps most similar to shuffleboard. It's easy to pick up and well social.

In the near future, you should also expect the following such things from this group:

• Outings to NHL games, to the Catskills for snowshoeing, and to NYC Beer Week.

• Opportunities to play soccer with (and against) other Canadians in charity tournaments and leagues.

• Information about how to get involved in the local community by volunteering with award-winning non-profits - some of which are run by Canadians living in New York.

• Myriad other ways to get involved in local life with like-minded Canadians and non-Canadians.

Join us and jump in this Thursday's Crokinole session! There's perhaps no better way to meet new people than over this classic Canadian fixture.
results.name: The Alternative Canadian Expat Meetup

results.description: Hi there! My name is Ana, and this is a Meetup Group for people who are dealing with, have ever had to deal with, or have had to help someone else deal with a change of lifestyle due to a temporary disability. As for me, I recently suffered a tibial plateau fracture skiing in VT, and once I came out of surgery, I had to readjust to my daily routine. Simple activities, like washing my hair, became a real chore! Then I thought that there are probably plenty of people in my neighborhood--or not too far away--who are experiencing the same thing! So whether you've been there or are still going through it, I hope for this to be a place where we can get together and share our experiences to inspire one another to get back to our old selves!

results.description:

We are one of the most active camera clubs in northern New Jersey. Our members join to learn about taking good photographs, to see the work of top photographers and to share their own photographic ideas. Our club has been home to outstanding photography for over 60 years, and has been meeting in Nutley, New Jersey since 1963.

Our goal is to learn and grow as photographers. This is accomplished as members exchange ideas, share experiences and offer technical advice. Outside experts are also brought in to offer workshops and demonstrations.

We are a member of New Jersey Federation of Camera Clubs (NJFCC) and the Photographic Society of America (PSA). As a club, we have successfully participated in competitions held within both organizations and received not only club recognition, but also individual ribbons, medals and trophies.

results.description:
Hello my lovely new friends! Please read the description all the way down, thank you.

I am a new business owner in the Central NJ area and this group is for my fellow new female business owners and/or professionals that are transitioning into entrepreneurship. Mastermind groups offer a combination of brainstorming, education, peer accountability, and support in a group setting to sharpen your business and personal skills. The main purpose of this group is to hold each member accountable to her goals, provide access to information/resources, and support. How may we serve you?

This group is for success-minded ladies who take full responsibility for their lives and are focused on solutions. We are made up of a diverse array of women. We will be small so we can develop a real community and connection.

*This group is not a company, we are not peddling services or products, and our meetings will not serve as a platform to advertise any companies or businesses*.

How it will work - The Roundtable

This group will meet at least once a week. Each lady will take a turn and speak about what she is working on, goals, and with what she needs help. Whenever a person is speaking, everybody else will be respectful and listen to her without judgment. Then for the next 20-30 minutes, the rest of us will brainstorm, share ideas, solutions, and constructive feedback towards a solution for her. Each lady will feel free to share as much or as little as she wants. This will not be a "woe is me" session and every lady will be safe to share herself without fear of being attacked or made to feel ridiculous.

Kindness above all else is our most valued principle.

After the meeting is over, we can leave, or just chat and get to know each other. Come prepared to laugh, form friendships, and have intelligent discussions with other incredible females.﻿
results.name: Millionaire Ladies' Mastermind Group

results.description:
NATURAL WAY OF LIVING was established by Irmansyah Effendi, M.Sc. in 2014 as a company that endeavors to help others to be physically, mentally, emotionally and spiritually healthier by using the physical body more in accordance with the way it was created by The Creator through organizing relevant workshops as well as training centers. 

The pioneering program from NATURAL WAY OF LIVING is the Secrets of Natural Walking™ (SONW) workshop that was officially launched in January 2014 in 3 major cities in Indonesia with more than 500 participants in total.  In an astonishingly short time frame, even before the workshop ends or just a few days afterwards, so many people have experience significant and tangible benefits. Workshop participants who needed surgery for their physical problems were healed. Others experienced better improvement in body shape and natural weight loss compared to routinely going to the gym 3-4x/week. Most people also enjoy feeling more refreshed and energetic in their daily lives.

Why is Secrets of Natural Walking So Effective?

Secrets of Natural Walking (SONW) is a very natural walking therapy, giving various extraordinary benefits for body shape, health and even for our internal organs, thoughts and mood, without any side effects at all. SONW is very beneficial for people of all ages even for seniors. SONW is beneficial for those who both in ill and good health.

We do not walk properly

All of the known benefits from these various researches are only a minor part of the true benefits we can achieve from walking. The true benefits have not yet been achieved because most people still do not walk properly.

What’s the proof? Look at the soles of your shoes, for most people the left and right soles are worn out unequally. Measure the size of your calves. For most people, the shape and size may not be the same because they do not use both sides of their body equally. This is why, what should naturally happen when we take each step cannot happen properly. 

Natural Healing Abilities

Our body is specially designed and created. A grazed skin or a broken bone can naturally mend itself. Our body is equipped with countless natural healing abilities. However,  because the improper way we walk, use our body and improper posture, many of these natural healing abilities are not functioning maximally or even completely stopped.

Our bodies that have the amazing natural healing abilities are also equipped with the most natural way to correct/reactivate these natural healing abilities is the most natural way. Something most humans do everyday.

What is that? WALKING

Beyond a simple step

For those who do not know, eating is just to fill the stomach. On the contrary, our body needs various nutrition from the food that we eat. The same with walking. Every proper step will naturally adjust our legs, muscles, joints, spine, and through the meridians and reflexology zones cleanse all blockages and reactivate the natural healing functions, improving our overall health including our internal organs.

results.description:
The Major Meetup Network are leaders/assistant leaders of large meetups. We intend to build a critical mass of large meetups, defined as:

• 1,000 members or more
• Actively running events (at least 3 annually)
• Focused on technology, startups, marketing/media/social media, the future and socializing.
• Initially limited to the NY metro area and later expanding to other metro areas.
• Operating ethically.
• Not political or religious in nature. 


By virtue of our substantial combined membership and ability to segment as above, we can:
• Be more appealing to sponsors and related partners. Sponsors wanting to reach larger numbers than most meetups can provide will be able to justify an investment in our network.
o The same sponsor that wouldn’t find it worthwhile to support a 1,200 member group could be more interested in one with 25,000 or 50,000+.
• More easily co-promote or co-produce events with each other.
• Negotiate more effectively with venues.
• Draw speakers to New York for multiple meetups.
• Share ideas, resources and post inquiries among ourselves.
• Secure member benefits and perks not available to our separate meetups. We will meet periodically to review direction and make connections. 


Join us and benefit from the power of our network. Open to Organizers and Assistant Organizers of Meetups with 1,000 or more members, subject to the sole discretion of this meetup’s organizer.
results.name: Major Meetup Network

topics.name: MeetUp Organizers Co_Organizers and Event Hosts

results.description:
Visualize basketball (or soccer), but played on the river in between downtown Brooklyn and lower Manhattan, in a kayak. 

Now picture this for free!

Brooklyn Kayak Guides–in association with the Brooklyn Bridge Park Boathouse and Conservancy–is setting up kayak polo games on Sunday afternoons. We've got the equipment (kayaks, vests, helmets, paddles), you bring the body, enthusiasm, and sportsmanship (shorts/sandals, too). Your level of experience doesn't matter. Prepare to get addicted. Soon you'll be passing the ball like some aquatic-John Stockton. Do you whitewater? Paddle leisurely? Nothing will improve your kayaking skills as rapidly as playing this game. 

The catch? We're limited to 15 participants per game, so reserve your spot for the game at 11AM. We'll put you in a team and give you a vest number. First-come first-served basis. Dedicated players and volunteers, though, will end up being teachers to others. 

Season begins in early June (June 7th 2015) and goes on for all 12 Sundays, till late August. 

We focus on individual attention and kayak mentoring, and is the best free kayak learning experience you can get in NYC. It's from 11am-12PM. 

• Our Meetup game is 11AM-12PM. Arrive at least 30 minutes before game time to be donned with vest, helmet, paddle, and kayak. 

• We're at Brooklyn Bridge Park, on pier 2. The High St station (A/C line) is closest, and is a nice 20 minute walk to pier 2 (so, to be on time, you should be exiting the station at around 10:10am).

Get ready to have fun.
results.name: Brooklyn Kayak Polo

results.description:
International Ministry Plus (IM+) is a ministry of the New Frontier Church created with one goal in mind: to spread the Gospel to people of all ages, races and colors.

“There before me was a great multitude that no one could count, from every nation, tribe, people and language, standing before the throne and in front of the Lamb.” -Rev 7:9-

New York City is often described as the capital of the world. It exerts a significant impact upon commerce, finance, politics, media, art, fashion, research, technology, education, and entertainment. New York City is also known as a great ‘melting pot’. As many as 800 languages are spoken and people from 196 countries are represented in the city. The World is here.

IM+ believes that New York City is the place on earth where this heavenly vision of people of all different nations, tribes and languages, worshiping the Lord Jesus together can be fulfilled. Therefore, IM+ strives to be a Global Church and obey the Great Commission in Matthew 28:19, “Therefore go and make disciples of all nations.”

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in soccer pick up games indoor and outdoor


Welcome to Streetsoccer.NYC!

this group is dedicated to promote  pick up soccer games.

This Group is for those who love the game of soccer and are looking for a friendly,exciting but competitive atmosphere to enjoy it.

Our games will be held  indoor at  1535 126th Street
College Point, NY 11356 ,

outdoor at Shelter rock rd school at 99 Shelter Rock Rd,New Hyde Park, NY 11040

and other designated location  in Queens and  Long Island  Nassau county. game format - from  5v5 to 11v11 depends on field size and players availability. 
Rules of Play
·  Never be disrespectful to other players or opponents
·  Foul language will be unacceptable
·  Obey the RSVP rules
·  No referees so please respect any call made by any player on the field.  All disputes will be settled by your Team Captain.
RSVP Rules
If you sign up and make a team for the game you are expected at the field ready, willing and able to play.  All Members can update their RSVP before teams are posted the night before the game.  If you fail to update timely or to show up at a game you will not be permitted to sign up for the next two weeks.  If you fail to show twice you will not be able to sign up for two months.  This rule is enforced in order to get the players on the field that want to play especially if there is a waiting list.  Any and all emergencies will be taken under consideration.

Welcome to Streetsoccer.NYC!
results.name: streetsoccer.nyc

results.description:
NP2.0 is a movement.


We believe that in order to thrive and grow in a rapidly changing world, nonprofits must go against the grain.


Conventional wisdom leads to conventional outcomes.


We believe the next generation nonprofit (or the “NP2.0”) is built on four pillars:


Dedication to data-based decision making

“High impact” beats “Low overhead”

Agility accelerates impact

A nonprofit’s workforce is it’s most valuable asset


Each month, we get together to discuss issues facing the nonprofit community both today and in the future, and how we can apply the four pillars to these issues. We’ll hear case studies from other members of the nonprofit world and learn how they tackle these challenges and discuss actionable solutions to spur innovation.
results.name: NP2.0 - Future Focused Nonprofits

results.description: At “Days for Girls”, we seek to empower girls globally, by suppling them with sustainable feminine hygiene solutions, so they can stay in class. When girls have no pads, they often remain in isolation a week a month, while they are bleeding, missing valuable school days. Adding days and years to a girls education prevents many negative outcomes: human trafficking, rape, fistulas, conflict in regions, maternal death rate and more. We have over 250 "Days for Girls" chapters in 14 countries making sustainable feminine hygiene products. We have aided girls in over 70 countries with roughly 200,000 menstrual kits. We are hosting a training in Manhattan 3/12, Thurs 9am-6pm. Our founder, Celeste Mergens, who is based in WA, will be in NYC this March to speak at the UN at the Global Summit on the Status of Women. Please join us for this great opportunity to train with Celeste, who is a global expert on women’s rights and practical solutions. By the end of the day you will be a certified Ambassador of Women's Health. Supplied with everything you need to know to educate a girl about her body, menstruation and self defense. All aspects of class are taught with awareness for cultural sensitivities and to best support the girls. This is a great seminar for anyone working or desiring to work in relief/aid or education anywhere domestically or internationally.All backgrounds welcome. You will laugh and cry but leave uplifted when you learn you can do something to aid women in the world. This day will be way better than you are even expecting it to be right now! When we help women, everyone benefits. Learn more at www.DaysforGirls.org
results.name: Ambassador of Women's Health Training

results.description:
NOW, that I have your many brains attention.
Ever find your self hunting FOR ANSWERS in the business, psychology or self-help sections of bookstores, ONLINE or doing Yoga?
ARE YOU FAN OF TED TALKS?

Explore The Many BRAINS Inside Your Head:
MOTIVATION BRAIN- What power(S) do you need to start or finish that project you know that you should? Join and find out the answers and more.
SOCIAL BRAIN- There are both skills and powers needed to connect to and influence or just make friends with other people. Everything social from office politic, networking, friendships, dating and romance is based on connecting SOCIAL BRAINS.
BUSINESS BRAIN- Start ups, entrepreneurships, publicly traded, and top consumer brands are all part of an endless maze of choices among multiple decision architectures within multiple stakeholders. Your decisions are also part of the maze-of-choices. The human brain is the source of all decisions in business.
When you join our community of ACTIVE-BRAIN USERS, you will discover many other brains that you use or have not used AWESOMELY.

If you have read Freakonomics, Predictably Irrational, Malcolm Gladwell's work, or similar books and you began to wonder where are NEW outside of the box self-Development solutions beyond just “believe in yourself” or “have high self-esteem?”
A number of fields have been assemble to create AWESOME BRAIN POWERS AND TOOLS: Behavioral Economics, Behavioral Psychology, Cognitive science, Neural Science, Social Psychology, Decision Theory, Positive psychology (Science of Happiness), and much more.
results.name: RAPIDLY TRANSFORM YOUR BRAIN-MIND COMMUNITY

results.description: Boomers, fitness is now play time!! Remember the sports we loved to play or wanted to play, and now we have let time and life take playing sports away? Calling on all boomers and echo boomers its time we stop thinking fitness means discomfort. Its time we got over the guilt of wasted fitness club membership money. Its time to stop feeling bad about the barley used fitness infommercial mail orders intended to get us fit in an unreasonably short number of days. Its time to reactivate our inner child and play sports for fitness. Play sports with other Boomers that believe some sports play is left in their maturing bodies. At the Baby Boom & Echo Boom Sports Skills Club we learn and re-learn sports skills and practice sports skills so we can play, play, play, play the games that were common to our childhood - kickball, basketball, ping pong, handball, softball, pool, four square, volleyball...if you can name the common childhood sport we can sharpen those skills so your inner Boomer child can play, play, play with other Boomers! Activities are affordable and availble at least three times a week, and activities are held at local recreation venues. The focus at each date of activity is to spend allocated time to sharpen your sports skills through guidance and instruction and then play, play, play your childhood sport!
results.name: North NJ Boomers Sharpen Skills & Fitness Play Sports Again

results.description:
**You acknowledge that you'll be an active member of this group by joining.**

I'm trying to start up a husky playtime group for some fun socialization lovers and companions of Siberian Huskies (and mixes). Socializing, husky interaction and etc. I would like to do meet-ups throughout the new york city area with the help of others if possible. There are a lot of Huskies out there that need interaction such as my husky .(who love to play rough) and I would to be the first (on this website) to help contribute and meet up. Siberian huskies have lots of energy, play rough while socialize with other dogs. I'm hoping to bring together a group of husky and husky mixes for regular play dates to

1) run that energy off!

2) let them socialize with dogs their own breed, and temperament.

3) meet regularly enough that they bond with their playmates. Its for socializing, free and fun.

On Weekends, mostly Sunday!

**You are responsible for your dogs' actions and their well being so make it a priority!**

NOTE:  We (group members) are professional guides and do not have certified training or insurance. Be aware, inherent hazards and risks are associated with walking, hiking and all other physical activities. You may participate with us in any activity but you do so at your own risk. You alone are responsible for your own safety and health. The more prepared you are, the better the chance you will remain safe. Your preparedness not only affects your safety but the safety and enjoyment of the whole group.

All events held are at you and your dog's own risk.

**I also ask if you choose not to attend an an event, please select not going as an option.**

By joining this group , you are agreeing to indemnify me and any other event host, and hold the event hosts harmless for whatever you, your dogs, your guests, may experience or cause at any of the events. We are merely participating in an activity ourselves and are simply inviting others to join in.
