The New York Swift Developers Meetup is part of NY's burgeoning mobile developer community.  

We’ll be presenting new developments in the language and tools, new frameworks, advanced animation techniques for great user interfaces and great new apps. For beginners, we’ll be discussing topics like functional programming, closures, optionals, and how memory management works in Swift. We want to build a great community that give support to developers as they learn the modern (and beautiful) new language that Apple has designed and created.

Hosts:
Aditya Narayan, is Co-Founder of Turn to Tech after having been Chief Architect at Marvel Entertainment & Head of Security Architecture at Starwood Hotels along with an Architect role at JP Morgan Chase. He holds an MS&BS in Physics from the Indian Institute of Technology. He also founded 1to1Tutor, a successful online Math company which has tutored over 25,000 students. Prior to that he created ‘InterStructures’ - the popular Windows-Linux interoperability platform and has various technology publications.

Michael Prenez-Isbell. Michael just left Conde Nast after 3 years as Manager for Mobile, working with brands like Vogue, Vanity Fair and The New Yorker, and hosted the New York iOS Developer’s Meetup quarterly in the Conde Nast auditorium.

results.description:
We are the oldest Spiritual Community in Yonkers.  We began work in 1684 but were founded as an organization in 1693.  In the early 1800's we were given the name St. John's Episcopal Church.  For over 320 years we have supported people as they sought the more in life, as they sought to love others, and to honor the divine.

Today, in the spirit of the renaissance of downtown Yonkers we are offering beautiful music and reflections on the spiritual life intended to benefit both those who are not and those who are religious.  We value all people, we value questions, we value authenticity.  We are calling this program "Drinking Deeply from the Well."  There are deep refreshing springs in our spiritual lives.  We hope all people will find this program a place for refreshment. 

We understand that today many people are disaffected with religion, and we respect that.  At the same time people long for greater and fulfilling spirituality in their life.  To help meet these needs the talks in church for the period March 1 through May 24 are meant to give away spiritual treasure discovered in our tradition for people to use as they will.  The series of talks is entitled, "Spirituality when Religion Fails".  It seeks to be insightful, relevant, practical and nurturing.

The core of our community is, of course, those who choose to follow the teachings of Christ according to the understanding of the Episcopal Church, yet we hope also to be a place where community, thoughtful reflection, spiritual practice, friendship and support are available for those who do not really want a "church" or "religion".  Why?  Because this place is for our whole community, and we respect people to make their best decisions for themselves.  Why?  Because when people personally invest in their spiritual life we trust that good will happen.
results.name: Drinking Deeply from the Well

results.description:
This is a Meetup for musicians and non-musicians alike who want to explore everything alt/indie/B-side in (mostly) music through playing acoustic music, attending live shows (including music-related films), and discussing books. Live performances/concerts will include folk, rock, pop, jazz, classical, world - as long as it's alt/indie/or B-side.  (See clarification below about the monthly jam.)

Monthly "B-Side" Acoustic Music Workshop: Each month, we will meet in a small group of up to about 14, divide into smaller groups of twos or threes to work on a songs collaboratively and then to perform them for the groups that same evening. They can be originals or covers, but We're aiming to play alternative/indie style music OR do alternative/indie/unique versions of classics. 

Clarification: 

Some people may be confused by the alt/indie/b-side thing.  To put it another way, it simply means bring something different!  While the emphasis is for more current alternative or indie singer songwriters/bands, b-side means we should also consider lesser known tracks from people/bands we all know and lover.  For example, here's a link to some not-often-played/covered Eagles songs    

http://ultimateclassicrock.com/most-underrated-eagles-songs/

Live Music/Arts Outings:  Ever want to attend go see a band like Belle & Sebastian, or the xx, Wilco - or maybe a cool film or art show? No problem! Each month, we will also offer up live music, art, or film outings. And if you want to add something to the calendar, all you need to do is e-mail me with the show you want to go and I will make you an assistant organizer or host for that show! We will try and mostly do venues that are not assigned seats so that we can hang out/talk before or during show. 

Bi-monthly Book Club: we will choose a music or arts related book and meet at various fun locations to read and discuss. Suggestions welcome!

results.description:
We are a group of Christian believers who have come to the Bronx from rural Pennsylvania. We have two families who recently have moved into the city to share our love with the people here. We originated as a result of day trips into the city for a number of years to share the light of the gospel. As we made acquaintances here, they requested a church where we could meet together. We started out as a one Sunday a month Bible study and as more interest grew we became a local body of believers with church services every Sunday and some services in the week. In June of 2014 we moved a pastor into the Bronx. Our congregation consists of the two families here, two families and some youth who drive in from Pennsylvania, and a number of dedicated people from the city. A personal note from the pastor:
Hi there! I am Tim. I was born in 1976. My brother (my co-pastor) and I are in the middle of six children. Today of those six, two are missionaries in Honduras, two of us are involved in the church plant here in the Bronx, and two are settled in Pennsylvania. My wife and I are known in the community here in South Bronx as the family with the 5 boys. That recently changed when boy number 6 joined the family. If you see our crew in the park or the store, be sure to stop us and say hello. We would love to make the acquaintance.
results.name: Light of Truth Mennonite Church Bronx 10455

results.description:
"Learning to program in an unstructured structured environment..."

Online learning has taken profound leaps forward with institutions from Amazon to Stanford University offering FREE online courses. The variety and scope of courses cover a wide range of material, but there is one constant-- you and I, the lone learners. This is especially true of course work from Universities, where we are learning in unstructured structured environments. 

From working on great sites like codecademy.com, learnpythonthehardway.org, udacity.com, and having been a course instructor myself; I can speak directly to the only component that’s missing…a peer review group. A real social network to drive us forward as E-Learners.

My goal is to fill this void.  Members of our meetup will work with each other on course material at our meetups--collaborating conceptually on processes and ideas vs. giving out answers since that defeats the whole learning thing.

If you have a passion for learning and an affinity for technology join us today!

Krishna
results.name: Java E-Learning & Programming Meetup

results.description: I'm a single parent of a 14-year-old. I like to try to get out of town (and even out of the country) once or twice a year. Traveling on our own gets lonely - teenagers, especially, are really much happier when they have the company of other kids/young people. So we have been experimenting with group travel. So far, we've taken one tour designed for families, and are planning to take two others in the coming year. While the tour we took was quite good in some ways, it would have been better if there were more families like ours (the tour was mainly composed of large extended family groups with two parents, grandparents, etc.). I thought it might be nice to gather other single parents (meaning single, divorced, or widowed - anyone traveling as one parent with one or more children) facing the same trip planning issues and share our experiences and maybe even - if it really works out - figuring out how to join up for group travel. I'm not interested in camping or low-budget type of tours, so I specified "high-end" (meaning very good tour group, really good accommodations, etc.). So we'll have to see who signs up. If there's interest, maybe we can then set up a meeting somewhere and talk over coffee or brunch and see where it goes from there. Depending on what's most convenient, if we do meet, we can do it somewhere that's centrally located in the Greater New York area (maybe in Manhattan).
results.name: Single Parents Interested in High-End Family Group Travel

results.description:
Five people with ideas about shaping the future of their profession organized their thoughts and their peers to form the Grant Professionals Association. GPA is the first organization focused solely on the advancement of grantsmanship as a profession and the support of its practitioners. (Read our Mission Statement)

Since its inception in 1998, GPA has grown rapidly. With over 1,800 current members internationally, the opportunities and benefits of membership continue to attract people from all over the globe. In the spring of 2004, Birmingham, Alabama became the first city to form a local chapter. In the year following, additional chapters were formed. The process of local involvement and self determination is an important benefit of membership.

Member participation in national conferences held annually across the country has provided the practical fabric of a rapidly growing network of diverse grant professionals. Each year, GPA's conference provide timely and informative workshops, round-table discussions, member receptions, funder panels, vendor exhibits and the popular individual proposal review sessions are all available to registered attendees. Additionally, the opportunity to network with peers from around the globe, listen to the keynote address, and participate in the annual membership meetings ensure that possibilities abound at this exciting event.

Fostering a constant critical eye on the current state of the craft, the GPA Journal (published annually) provides a forum for book and article reviews, discussions on best practices, and scholarly examination of the state of the profession. The member’s electronic forum provides another venue for the exchange of ideas, issues, methodologies and other relevant discourse on a member-to-member basis.

For the long term, GPA continues to lead the efforts to establish a formal credentialing process. Grant Professional Certification Institute (GPCI) was formed as an affiliate organization to GPA for the purpose of overseeing the development of critical standards within an ethical framework that will help define the future of grantsmanship.
results.name: (GPA) Grant Professionals Association NJ Chapter

What makes our group different from other networking groups...well US!   Our goal is to close the gap between all work and no play networking and social groups where the swapping of business cards would probably be met with a raised eyebrow.  We're all coming from a place of wanting to share who we are and what we do!  Hope to see you HERE!

results.description:
This group is especially for beginners who would love to draw, but think they can't make a straight line.   You will be able to draw anything once you learn the basic principles.   We will all start out with the same drawing so that we can all progress at the same rate together.  Included in the first $10 fee will be a #2 pencil, eraser and your first sheet of paper to start your first drawing.  Eventually, you should get a #4 drawing pencil from Michael's or any other craft or art supply store you have nearby.  Suggested paper:  Strathmore, Windpower smooth Bristol, 14" x 17", 15 sheet, 100 lb. pad of paper.  

Vikki Anderson has had many art shows throughout the years in the tri-state area.  Her mediums are watercolor, acrylic and oil.  She uses interwoven paper in much of her artwork, but has become fascinated with drawing over the past five years and has had drawn many wonderful subjects including scenery, birds, pets and various stone images.  She has taught art in local libraries and now wishes to teach art in her home for those who truly want to give pencil drawing a chance.  She hopes you will join her group as you will be amazed at the results.

topics.name: How to Maintain your Natural Hair in Winter Time
Keeping a Professional Image with Natural Hair

results.description:
Kinky, curly, coiled, natural hair meetup is a group created for naturals who want to learn how to care for they hair naturally. We will learn how to use natural, chemical free, safe, healthy products to promote hair growth, strength and healing.

We will also try to promote your company, business or event providing it relates to natural haircare and or NATURAL, safe and chemical free hair care products. Please inbox me if you have any questions about it.

You can also join our Facebook groups here------>

100% NATURAL (Relaxer free)

Natural Hair and Skin care Therapy with Essential Oil

Anyone who is intersted in natural solutions would be so welcomed


My Story

When I decided to go natural 4 years ago, it was not because I hated relaxers or because I wanted to get back to my natural roots. It was one of the steps to a total and significant overhaul of my life. I decided to take greater responsibility for my body, soul, and mind. I was very conflicted in my heart; I liked my relaxed hair, but I realized that the chemicals in the relaxers were not good for the health issues I had. Since I did not know what direction to take, I spent one week praying and journaling my prayers, thoughts, and any answers that God had given me. After a week, the answer was obvious; I needed to change my hair care routine. There were three steps I took to turn things around.

The first step of my natural hair journey was to educate myself on natural African textured hair. I had a relaxer for 25 years of my then 36 years of life, so I had no idea how to even take care of my REAL TEXTURED hair. I followed natural hair blogs, watched natural hair YouTube videos, and read books and articles.

The next step was to stop relaxing my hair. At first this was easy, but one year into it and I was rocking an Erykah Badu African wrap-up EVERYDAY!! My wash routine (which started the night before) would sometimes take over 3 hours and consisted of pre-shampooing, washing, deep conditioning, washing, moisturizing, sealing, and protective styling. This took a lot of time and gallons of water. I had to stop swimming, water aerobics and doing serious cardio in the gym because the so-called natural products would run down my face and burn my eyes.

Last step I took was to I made 14 satin pillow cases and sleep bonnets. You all know us beautiful colored girls HAVE to tie our hair up at night with satin scarves or hair bonnets, sleep on satin pillow cases and wear satin scarves in the winter to protect our edges and keep moisture in. Well, you also know that satin hair bonnets, don’t always stay on our heads at night, so sometimes I’d wake up with product on my face.

HAIR PRODUCTS were the hardest thing ever. I spent lots of money and had various brands of so-called natural products. At first it would work and then it would stop, as if my hair was saying, “Yo, chick, I’m over this! Next!” I battled with lots of end knots, dryness, and split ends. My hair was growing but I could never leave it out because it would dry up so fast. I would have to saturate my hair over and over again with moisturizers. My biggest concern at that point was that it would eventually seep down my face and into my eyes. I hated that, so I did some more research on products I could use. Last year, I finally decided to go “Do-It-Yourself” for my hair. I was basically DIY for almost everything except my makeup (which is my 2015 goal)! I was a bit nervous, but with God’s help, I found amazing recipes and ingredients to use.

This opened up a new world of hair care products to me. I felt more in control and I felt confident. I controlled what I used in my hair because I made it. This was so exciting, and I made many different combinations of things. My motto was that I should be able to ingest anything I put on my skin and in my hair. My hair products consisted a combination of Young Living Essential Oils (Lavender, Rosemary, Lemon, Geranium, Cedar wood, Thyme, and Clary sage) with organic carrier oils (Almond Oil, Avocado Oil, Cocoa Butter, Coconut Oil, Grape-seed Oil, Jojoba oil, Olive oil and Shea Butter). In addition, I used Vegetable Glycerin and Aloe Vera gel for moisturizers and Dr Bronners’ unscented soap to create my own shampoo solutions.  These products worked wonders on my hair and skin, along with cutting down my wash routine drastically. 

I can now go swimming, do water aerobics and hard cardio in the gym wihtout worrying about products dripping from my hair. Also, whenever my hair bonnet would come off at night I rest assured that the products in my hair are also good for my face too. HOLLA!!  (Vegetable Glycerin is pretty sweet). It took several months of trial and error, but I am now able to confidently write and say that my hair has flourished under these products, and I myself have become healthier for it.
results.name: Kinky, Curly, Coiled, Natural Hair Meetup

results.description:
Greek cuisine is a reflection of the country’s rich and diverse culture. Being at the crossing point of East & West, Greece’s great and turbulent history is reflected in its traditional food. Through the centuries, Venetians, Romans, Balkans, Turks, and Slavs have contributed to the culinary culture of this small Mediterranean country.  

Mostly influenced by the Turkish tradition, the Greek cuisine is abundant with meze: small dishes served with an aperitif.   Hot or cold, spicy or savory they are served in little plates to be shared with everyone at the table, providing variety of flavor and texture.  

Join us to learn how to make four healthy meze dishes that will impress your guests and will add some variety to your starters’ portfolio. Original price 75USD. Discounted price 50USD

Fried Green Peppers in vinegar sauce & garlic {tiganites piperies} #vegetarian#vegan#glutenfree

topics.name: Physical and Emotional Balance with Essential Oil

results.description:
The next time that you drive past a field of fresh lavender or hike through a pine forest, breathe deeply – you’re experiencing the soul-soothing power of essential oils. But essential oils are more than nice scents; these powerful plant extracts are your path to the natural radiance that we are committed to helping you discover. 

This meetup is for anyone wanting to experience, learn and share about the natural healing properties of 100% pure essential oils. 

All workshops and information sessions are designed to have you come away learning something new about the use of essential oils to benefit your health and well-being. 

We will only be sharing about Young Living 100% pure therapeutic grade essential oils, essential oil blends and essential oil-infused products. 


ABOUT THIS GROUP

This  group is for individuals wanting to learn about essential oils and the amazing health benefits of using them. This event will spend time looking at everyday over the counter products and the chemicals and toxins in those products, then learn how we can use our oils to make better products for our families.

This group is about essential oils, which means to get the most out of this Meetup community, you need OILS. As the organizer, I want to serve this group with the best  information I can, so I  make this point. 

You, as a member you  can participate in our essential oils classes using any oil you are comfortable with. But I would be careless in not warning you to make sure that you do your research, and buy the best, therapeutic  grade oil. 

In our classes, when I speak about essential oils and its health benefits, I am  speaking of Young Living Essential Oils exclusively. I cannot speak of any other brand because I do not personally use them, and I do not know the product. 

In this FREE, 90-minute workshop we explore:

How and why oils work 

Modern Medicine vs. Natural Medicine 

Essential Oil Quality 

What are the varied uses of essential oils? 

How can essential oils support your current health challenges? 

How to incorporate oils into your everyday life for optimal health




WHAT ARE ESSENTIAL OILS


Essential Oils are natural aromatic compounds found in the seeds, bark, stems, roots, flowers and other parts of plants. They have been used throughout history in many cultures for their medicinal and therapeutic benefits. 

Dr. David Stewart, Ph.D., D.N.M. Integrated Aromatic Science Practitioner, describes the function of these fragrant essential oils in his book, The Chemistry of Essential Oils Made Simple: God’s Love Manifest in Molecules.

Essential oils have been called “the life blood of a plant.” They circulate through plant tissues and pass through cell walls, carrying nutrition into cells and carrying waste products out. [Page 59]

When essential oils are applied to people, they do the same thing, carrying oxygen into cells and carrying waste products out. In fact, essential oils are one of nature’s best body cleansers. They can cleanse our cellular receptor sites of pharmaceutical drugs, petrochemicals, and other disruptors of intercellular communication. They can also chelate heavy metals and other toxins, helping to remove and flush them through the liver, colon, sweat, lungs, and kidneys. They can also increase our ability to absorb vitamins and other nutrients. [Page 59]

Why I use Essential Oils

Essential oils have also been used for thousands of years for cosmetic purposes, as well as for their spiritually and emotionally uplifting properties. Young Living has always been at the forefront of bringing this ancient tradition to modern users, introducing millions to a total mind body wellness they may never have dreamed possible. Primarily extracted through careful steam distillation but also through cold pressing, the purest essential oils are far more powerful than the botanicals from which they were extracted. Any time you hold a bottle of our powerful essential oils, you are holding nature's pure essence. Any time you hold a bottle of our powerful essential oils, you are holding the pure essence of health-promoting botanicals that can be diffused, inhaled, applied topically, incorporated into massage, or taken internally to:

 Inspire a positive emotional state: Each essential oil’s complex, pleasant, and unique scent activates the limbic system—the brain’s center of emotion and memory—differently. Essential oils can be your key to a more fulfilling and balanced emotional life.

Essential oils are convenient, quick and easy to use.You can wear them during the day, diffuse them in your home or work place, or simply keep them in your pocket. Essential oils can be used in massage, and to enhance meditation and concentration.

Essential oils  penetrate the skin and cell membranes.They can actually diffuse throughout the blood and tissues instantly in a matter of seconds! Oils cross the brain-blood barrier and reach the amygdala and other limbic parts of the brain that control our mood, emotions and beliefs. So they can help us with our ability to handle stress, anger or any other emotion we are dealing with! 

Enhance your physical wellness :Modern lifestyles don’t always create optimal conditions for physical wellness. Poor diet, lack of exercise, and an overabundance of environmental toxins can leave the body unbalanced and diminish energy levels. From cleansing and weight management to supporting every system of the body, essential oils and essential oil-infused supplements can provide the targeted solutions you need to restore balance and feel your best. 

Essential oil benefits include oxygenating properties.Because they contain oxygen molecules they can transport nutrients to cells that are nutrient and/or oxygen deprived. Healthy cells need oxygen. 

Essential oil benefits include that they are high in antioxidants. We know that antioxidants strengthen the body’s systems to prevent the damaging effects of aging, diet, and the environment; and eliminate free radicals. The Oxygen Radical Absorbance Capacity (ORAC) which tells you the antioxidant capacity of a food item is documented for many essential oils. Clove essential oil has an ORAC value of 1,078,700 µTE/100g; this is a million more than the value for carrots which is 210 µTE/100g! 

Purify your home: Harsh chemical formulas aren’t your only home cleansing option. Enjoy peace of mind without compromise when you polish countertops, clean sticky messes, and cleanse dirty surfaces with the gentle but effective power of essential oils,

Refine your skin: Purge chemicals from your beauty routine and rediscover your natural glow. An ancient skin care secret, essential oils can help promote a clear-looking complexion, soften the appearance of signs of aging, and nurture healthy-looking hair. 

Essential oils soothe muscles and joints. They also can assist with minor aches and pains related to everyday activities especially in combination with massage. Yeah!  

Essential oil soothe digestion. Peppermint (Mentha piperita)is one of the oldest and most highly regarded herbs for soothing digestion, it may also restore digestive efficiency.  

Essential oil benefits include d-limonene a powerful antioxidant Lemon consists of 68 percent dlimonene. 

Create deep spiritual awareness: Incense and essential oils from plants have always played an important part in religious and spiritual ceremonies, helping participants to transcend the trivial and connect with something larger than themselves. Research shows that the pure constituents in these oils stimulate olfactory receptors and activate regions in the brain’s limbic system associated with memory, emotion, and state of mind. To enhance your spiritual practice, dilute and apply meditative, empowering essential oils directly to wrists, feet, and behind the ears, or diffuse in a quiet space.

Why I chose Young Living Essential Oils

Young Living is proud to set the standard for essential oil purity and authenticity by carefully monitoring the production of our oils through our unique Seed to Seal® process. From the time the seed is sourced until the oil is sealed in the bottle, we apply the most rigorous quality controls possible to ensure that you are receiving essential oils exactly the way nature intended.

Our exclusive Seed to Seal process includes five painstaking steps:

Seed -Potent essential oils come from plant species that have been authenticated by Young Living experts. Species certification involves scientific research, field study, university partnerships, and on-site planting certification.

Cultivate – Through cultivation on the four Young Living farms, Young Living Essential Oils has mastered the creation of pure, potent essential oils. The company takes this knowledge around the world to co-op farms to certify that these farms’ growing processes meet Young Living’s strict quality standards.

Distill – Young Living’s proprietary low-temperature, low-pressure steam distillation process ensures that the beneficial plant compounds in every batch of essential oil remain uncompromised during the extraction process.

https://vimeo.com/97562865

Test – Each essential oil must pass Young Living’s stringent testing to ensure the optimal bioactive natural compounds are present. Young Living uses its own internal labs, in addition to third-party audits, to verify that international purity and potency standards are met and surpassed.

https://vimeo.com/97562866

Seal – Young Living completes the Seed to Seal process by carefully sealing each bottle of essential oil before shipping them to members worldwide.

results.description:
ABOUT US: 
The North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club, an outdoor recreation and conservation group founded in 1922 in New York City, sponsors hikes of different levels and other events on weekends and Thursdays throughout the year. Hike destinations in the scenic and historic Hudson Highlands region of New York and New Jersey include Sterling Forest, Ramapo Reservation, Harriman-Bear Mountain State Park, Jockey Hollow, and the West/East Hudson trails. Special outings may involve trips to other destinations, such as the Catskills and Adirondack Mountains.  

A full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes and announcements are also posted on our Facebook page.

MEMBERS: 
Members are a diverse group of men and women of all ages, families and outdoor enthusiasts, those interested in a workout, and people who want to enjoy beautiful vistas in good company.  After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the Adirondack Mountain Club (ADK) to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities. 

Membership comes with a variety of benefits including, among other things:  a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region. To join as a member, visit the ADK website. 

OUR HIKES:
New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance.

   Pace Ratings: 
      A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster
      B = Moderate - about 2 mph
      C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

   Distance: Noted in miles

   Terrain Ratings: 
      A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, possible rock scrambling
      B = Moderate climbs and descents
      C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B-7-A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing (moisture wicking, extra layers, no jeans/sneakers) and bring the proper gear (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials), food and at least two liters of water. 

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

If you have any questions about our hikes or other North Jersey Ramapo chapter activities, please send us an e-mail at info@hudsonhikers.org or post on our message board.

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

     Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

     Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots. Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

     Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

     Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

     Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike.  For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

     Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

     Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

     Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:
Please be considerate of event hosts/organizers and others who may want to attend an event by not being a "NO SHOW" (failing to show up when you've RSVP'd "yes") or a "LATE CANCEL" (changing RSVP to a "no" within 24 hours of an event).  If you have a history of No Shows and/or Late Cancels, we may have to bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space, in favor of those with a positive attendance history.
results.name: Adirondack Mountain Club - NJR Chapter

Practice conversational Spanish in a relaxed, encouraging atmosphere with a NJ-certified Teacher of Spanish. This group has established meetings for both beginners and intermediate level Spanish students. For more information about instructor Tricia Idrobo and her classes, see https://amistadspanish.wordpress.com/about or e-mail her at pfressidrobo (@) hotmail.com.

Beginners Conversation – Thursday evenings 7:00 – 8:30 PM

Meets in private homes in Livingston, New Jersey

This group is for beginning Spanish students who have had at least a few classes and would like to practice what they have learned. We select a topic and engage in conversation, as well as vocabulary and grammar activities related to that topic. At times we use a text. There is a $10 fee per class, which goes to the professional services of the teacher, as well as to Meetup fees.

Intermediate Conversation – Monday evenings, 7:00 – 8:30 PM

Meets in restaurant on border of Livingston and Roseland, New Jersey

This group is for intermediate to advanced students who feel comfortable in holding a basic conversation, and have studied various verb tenses and intermediate vocabulary. At these meetings/classes, we converse entirely in Spanish, and read and discuss articles in Spanish. There is a $10 fee per class, which goes to the professional services of the teacher, as well as to Meetup fees. Note: this fee does not include any food that you purchase at the restaurant.

We encourage active participation:

Our Meetup encourages active participation and occasionally removes inactive members. Members are considered inactive if they have not attended a meeting in three months or more. Exceptions are made if a member explains his or her circumstances and expresses the desire to join us in the near future.

If at any time your situation changes and you wish to rejoin the group, we will welcome you back! Please feel free to contact me with any questions at pfressidrobo@hotmail.com

results.description:
This group is geared towards younger (20s and 30s) people who are looking to try new cuisines, restaurants, and share in interesting conversations and make some new friends.

So far (as of mid-August) the median all in price for a meal with the group has been around $35, with meals ranging from $16 to $300.

My goal with the group is to combine the best elements of many different food groups I have been to. Here is what sets this group apart:

1). We will typically have 1-3 meals per week. Some weeks will have more and some will have less. So far we have averaged around 2 per week.

 2). I am aiming to organize smaller dinners so everyone can get to know each other and we avoid being a large and awkward group. Dinners will almost always be around 4-5 people. This makes it very important that you show up if you RSVP. So far I have been asking new members for a written confirmation of attendance and we have had 100% attendance. I hope this will continue.

3). Fees: I hate it when meetups charge a few dollars from each member. It makes me feel like the organizer is making money instead of bringing people together to enjoy an activity. I will cover all the meetup fees for now. If anyone wants to contribute feel free to but for now I am not going to ask.

4). A lot of groups seem to do the same activities or go to the same places over and over again. I will find new and exciting places to try that have good write ups and reviews. That being said, I am always open to member suggestions, so please send me suggestions of places you want to go.

Thanks and I hope you join the group and we can have a lot of fun exploring the amazing NYC food scene. Please feel free to reach out with any questions.
results.name: Young Foodies (20s and 30s)

results.description:
Welcome, movie lovers!    

This is the Movie Appreciation Club:  Dissecting one movie at a time!  

Whether you're a newbie movie fan or seasoned cinephile, the Movie Appreciation Club is the place for you!

We have on-going Movie Appreciation Workshops to better understand the craft behind the movie magic. Each gathering will focus on ONE particular movie.  We touch on the various disciplines involved in moviemaking from screenwriting, acting, editing as well as camera & lighting choices.

This is our chance to dive into a movie, dissect all of its moving parts and discover how they're all woven together to create a cinematic experience. 

We are kicking things off with "The Sixth Sense."  Some suggestions for future workshops include:  "Pulp Fiction," "Finding Nemo," "Psycho," "The Godfather," "Fight Club," "China Town," "Rear Window," "Psycho," "Star Wars," "The Matrix," "Toy Story," "Bridesmaids," "Jaws," "The Color Purple," "Reservoir Dogs," "Memento," "Thelma and Louise," "Goodfellas" and "The Shawshank Redemption."

Our Headquarters:   Videology Bar and Cinema's screening room is a fantastic space in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.  Drinking and eating during the workshop is encouraged.  

Join other cinema enthusiasts for entertaining and enlightening lectures/ conversations about the various crafts that come together to create the magic of movies!    

Dive in, dissect and discover cinema in a new way with the Movie Appreciation Club.
results.name: Movie Appreciation Club

results.description: The 5Rhythms® comprise a simple movement practice designed to release the dancer that lives in every body, no matter what its shape, size, age, limitations and experience. To find your dance is to find yourself at your most fluid and creative level. While the practice itself is the essence of simplicity, it has the power to catalyze deep healing and creative expression. The primary teaching of this work is: If you put the psyche in motion, it will heal itself. The five rhythms are: Flowing, Staccato, Chaos, Lyrical, and Stillness. They come together to create the Wave, a movement meditation practice. Rather than having steps to follow, each rhythm is a different energy field in which you find you own expression and choreography, thereby stretching your imagination as well as your body. Each rhythm is a teacher and you can expect to meet different and sometimes unknown aspects of yourself as your dance unfolds and your practice of the rhythms deepens over time. What to expect / what happens in class? In every class or workshop, there is always a wide range of experience in the 5Rhythms work, from first-timers to certified Wave addicts. In any given class, the teacher will be following the energy of the room. So, while the essential map is one of five rhythms, the teacher might take the class through the entire Wave or focus on just one rhythm or one facet of the rhythm. The rhythms themselves are gateways to literally thousands of different movement landscapes. Like the body, they are alive and designed to catalyze the dancer’s movement expression in the moment. You are different every time you walk into the room; so is the group and so is your teacher. Therefore, each class holds completely unique possibilities. Class is located at the beautiful studios of Hamilton Health and Fitness (HHF), at 161 Erie Street (by Hamilton Park). HHF is a unique fitness center, offering integrated services for the body, mind and soul. Class cost: No charge for full members or HHF $20 for non-members $15 for non-member students and seniors

results.description:
I created this group for creative, smart, adventurous women who enjoy trying new experiences to come together to support one another as we get out of our comfort zones and get clear on our passions and purpose.

You’re in the right place if you know you have a greater calling inside of you than just working in a job and doing the 9-5 (or more!) corporate grind. Maybe you have a desire to help people, aspire to be traveling the world while making loads of money and loving your life. You know you desire to do more than work in a J-O-B but you aren’t exactly sure what that “more" is.

When you're caught up working in a 9-5 job it can be really easy to get disconnected from what lights you up and brings you joy. You’re so focused on someone else’s agenda that it’s hard to focus on your own. From this disconnected place it can be really difficult to discover what your next step is, what your passion and purpose is, whether it’s in the form of a hobby or in the form of a business. 

I personally find that when I’m outside of my comfort zone and trying different things is when I get connected to what is really true for me and it’s when inspiration and creativity strikes.

Let's get together for activities and events that make us laugh and smile, teach us something new or trying something that we've always wanted to, but maybe couldn't find anyone to go with us. This could be anything from wine tastings, dancing, taking art/painting/jewelry classes, volunteer/charity work and WAY more fun stuff to help you get in touch with what really excites you and lights you up so that you can get clear on your next step, whether its creating a passion project on the side or starting up a new business. (I am totally open to your suggestions also. This is OUR group and I want it to be filled with people and activities that are awesome!)

Join me and the other amazing women in the group as we desire and aspire to live a more fulfilling, joyful, adventurous life on our own terms.


Some fine details:

• The costs of the activities (if there is a charge) are your responsibility. 

• If you need to cancel your RSVP, please do it 24 hours in advance, or more.
results.name: Hoboken Women (Fun, Experience and Purpose-Seekers)

results.description:
The Brooklyn Gift Connection is an experiment in building community and the new economy. How many of our needs and wants can we fill by connecting with members of our community, or people they know? What happens when we fill each other's needs and wants without expecting anything in return? Rather than arrange exchanges, we give our goods and services freely. Gratitude takes the place of money. You feel gratitude when you receive a gift; you express your gratitude by paying it forward. Through this beautiful experiment, we seek to test the hypothesis that we can establish richer relationships, and live richer lives, right here in New York City - if we risk leaning on each other a bit more, and thereby realizing our collective wealth. 

In our first year or so of meetings (called Gift Circles), we saw exchanges ranging from the small and concrete to the huge and amazing. Members of the community gave each other [for free] a phone cord, books, counseling, homemade chocolates, therapy, decluttering help, places to stay while catching up on rent, garden consulting, a Kindle, jobs, and connections of all kinds to our extended families and friends. Please join us to try it out!

The Brooklyn Gift Connection currently meets at the Brooklyn Society for Ethical Culture (53 Prospect Park West, Brooklyn, NY 11215) once per month. Each session, or Gift Circle, has three main parts:

- Sharing wants and needs - What do you want or need? You might ask for cooking lessons, a book, a dog sitter for the weekend, help cleaning your apartment, writing help, shoes, a foot massage, tools, a shoulder to cry on, a lamp, tools, an apartment, or anything at all! Whether your requests are granted will depend on who's in the Circle and what resources they can call on.

- Offering gifts - What do you want to give to the community as a whole, or to one or more people within the community? You might offer a jar of pickles, a hug, a bike, friendship, a couch to crash on, a ride to the airport, guitar lessons, sewing help, a job, a home-cooked meal, an E-reader, or (again) anything at all!

- Expressing gratitude - What do you feel grateful for? In particular, you might bear witness to gifts received through the Gift Connection.

With each meeting, we seek to rotate facilitation and change up the format - so the experience stays fun and the gifts keep flowing! 

Further reading:

Sacred Economics by Charles Eisenstein (go here to read the book at no charge/as a gift)

The Gift by Lewis Hyde
results.name: The Brooklyn Gift Connection

results.description: This is a group for anyone who believes that non-medical circumcision on any child should end. For this purpose, we offer trainings in mindfulness, movement, and leadership. Moreover, we support a growing community of committed individuals who seek to provide “the Hero’s hope”–the most essential element in the effort to make our world a better place. Our Programs: We have weekly meetups, weekend camps/retreats, and leadership programs across the NYC. To find out more email me! HeroesConnect.NY@Gmail.com Check out our website: www.HeroesConnect.Org, and follow us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/heroesconnect

results.description: At its core, yoga isn’t about exercise. It’s about connecting to life in its purest form — breath. It’s about the union of your mind, body, and spirit. My amazing teacher calls laughter yoga, "THE HAPPINESS WORKOUT" and says that it is a form of “edu-tainment” designed to relieve stress and cultivate joy through a fun mix of mind-body exercises. All it takes is an open mind and a willingness to let go. Your body doesn’t know the difference between spontaneous and induced laughter. So, even forced laughter produces endorphins and decreases cortisol—instant benefits for your mood and stress levels. Before you know it, fake laughter turns into real guttural belly laughs. That’s when the really good stuff gets released! Doing that on a regular basis actually re-wires your brain toward positivity. Benefits of Laughter Yoga Good Mood and More Laughter: Laughter Yoga helps to change your mood within minutes by releasing certain chemicals from your brain cells called endorphins. You will remain cheerful and in a good mood throughout the day and will laugh more than you normally do. Healthy Exercise to Beat Stress: Laughter Yoga is like an aerobic exercise (cardio workout) which brings more oxygen to the body and brain thereby making one feel more energetic and relaxed. Health Benefits: Laughter Yoga reduces the stress and strengthens the immune system.You will not fall sick easily and if you have some chronic health conditions, you will heal faster. Quality of Life: Laughter is a positive energy which helps people to connect with other people quickly and improves relationships. If you laugh more, you will attract many friends. Positive Attitude in Challenging Times : Everyone can laugh when life is good, but how does one laugh when faced with challenges? Laughter helps to create a positive mental state to deal with negative situations and negative people. It gives hope and optimism to cope with difficult times. How does Laughter Yoga work? Most of the Laughter in a Laughter Yoga session is initiated in the group with full body laughter exercises, clapping, eye contact and youthful playfulness. The "simulated" laughter soon turns into real, spontaneous and contagious laughter that brings much more oxygen to our body and brain, lifting our spirits and carrying over into our work, school and social lives. We will also end with a chocolate yum meditation. Dr Kataria who is the brain child behind laughter yoga says the 5 benefits of laughter yoga are : 1. Good Mood and more laughter 2. Healthy Exercise to beat stress ( and who couldnt use a little less stress in their life) 3. Health benefits ; lower your blood pressure and cholesterol. Help beat depression, chronic pain issues ...the possibilities are endless 4. Quality of life improves, you are able to connect with people more and on a more true and intimate level 5. Positive in Challenging times **All this just from laughing!** Come once or come every week for this amazing experience. All ages are welcome!
results.name: Laughter Yoga with Chocolate Yum Meditation

topics.name: Learn New Skills and Artistic Expression

results.description: This workshop is for artists and non-artists. You are the author of your life. Art completes you and that completion will allow you to create either the life you want or paint from your authentic self. You will have the inspiration and energy after our meet ups. Your constant Self doubt made you forget that you are a possibility. You will learn the practices that you can do on your own so you can continue your own expansion. Materials you might need: 1. If you already know that you will continue your practice please invest into a new and awesome multi media sketch book. We will turn it into your own text book and a book of personal inspiration and guidance. If not, loose paper is good too. 2. Colors that you choose matter. If you can afford good quality colors that have a better pigment please get them. Focus only on the colors that attract you if you are buying them separately. 3. Avoid oils an acrylic for this introductory workshop for easy clean up. 4. My suggestion would be to include markers and pencils and watercolors and tempera or quashes. Tempera and quashes will allow more vibrancy in your work. Watercolors is a great idea if you like soft and tender art, 8. Brushes of different sizes would be good. I would not suggest spending a lot of money on the expensive brushes yet. I will talk about other courses I teach or promote like Modern Breakthrough for women, Vedic Art, Paint Your Private Sessions, Meditation Meetups and Science of Completion workshops. I noticed that these session facilitate the artistic progress and I find them very relevant to your artistic growth. Donations are appreciated.

results.description:
Open Data and Open Government are changing the way people interact with leaders, innovate, and change, and it is time to consider how Open can change Business, and how Business can help make Open Governance drive economic growth, innovation, and national competitiveness. Business can help create demand for Open Data. It can work with Governments and Civil Society to implement Open Governance programs. And it can demonstrate how adoption of Open Governance Best Practices and Principles can improve Business decision-making and performance. This group will be dedicated to exploring the many roles Business can play in the global Open movement. We will discuss common challenges, explore local and global issues, and work together to document Best Practices and concrete implementations. The goal is to leverage Open Governance to make a difference in our businesses, nations, and the world.

Membership is completely Open. The Council will exist virtually and will meet in different geographies based on member initiative. Group Governance will be Open, Transparent, and Democratic.
results.name: The Open Governance Council

results.description:
Hey Chicadee's and welcome to City Chic's Meetup!

I started this group with you in mind :-)

Meaning the ladies who join this group, as you and I have much in common.  We are all educated, goal-setters, goal-getters and more than likely an awesome multi-taskers; as we have been accustom to living a New York City lifestyle.

They say "...if you can make it in New York City, you can make it anywhere..." and I truly believe it.  I am a student, blogger for my own site The Skinny NYC, influencer, tastemaker, content creator, up-coming tv/film producer, video editor, wife, event producer and I run a non-profit 501c3 organization.  With all of these titles, I have recently come to the realization that I must take time out to network with like-minded women on a regular basis.  The City Chic Meetup mission is to connect, communicate, support, create and have fun.  From bloggers, brand representatives, business owners, product managers, publicists, tv/film production, writers, talent, fashion designers, makeup artists and other similar female creatives can come together to help each other further her future, lend advice, share ideas etc.


https://vimeo.com/119720314


We welcome NYC born and bred chicadee's, as well, as newcomers to NYC and will show you all that New York has to offer.  We will maintain a weekly social/meetup; I will provide one of NYC's top party spots with a VIP section, Bottle Service and all of the bells and whistles so that we can bond, talk and have fun.  I often attend Exclusive and VIP events; I will also keep everyone in the loop of these events as they are usually invite only and very selective (brunches, press days, new product launches, trade shows, fashion events/panels, seminars etc, appreciation events, red carpets).  This way you may find connections you can work with.


I also started an annual awards ceremony, The Demiurge Awards which pays special attention to the skillfully adapted; who create, produce and bring business to NYC through innovation.  Our first honoree was Kate Stoltz...  Tv Personality, Model and Fashion Designer.  Next Awards is in planning and its looking like June/July.  I will definitely consider individuals in my group for an award and will invite you all to join in the festivities.

As a professional female in NYC, I know it can be hard to meet and establish friendships let alone business relationships in NYC.  Its like a secret society and on top of it all it can also be tough to set aside the time to hang out, but networking is necessary to get ahead in NYC. Let's break our busy work routines and meet new friends.  I look forward to meeting all of you!
results.name: City Chic's

Blogs will be discussed as well as writing articles for different venues.  I hope that this meetup will allow people with like minds to connect, help each other and eventually become good friends.

results.description:
Co-sensing is a fun way to become more present by exploring each of your five senses together with other people. Think of it as a sensory adventure that takes you both inward and outward.

Meditation is an inward journey. But rarely do we take that journey, the journey of deep presence, together with other people. How do we practice being deeply present, not just with ourselves, but with those around us in a fun way? Co-sensing is exactly this - it is the practice of becoming present with ourselves and others through a series of playful exercises focused on sensory exploration and creative dialog.

You’ll feel energized, present, creative, and deeply connected to yourself and those around you.
results.name: Co-Sensing NYC

http://www.instanthelpapp.org


Instant Help is the hottest new peer-to-peer job and task marketplace. We connect people who need help with people who are willing to meet that need. You can use our mobile app to outsource your tasks and occasional odd jobs and make time to enjoy the things you actually want to do!  You can also use your skills and spare time to make some extra cash helping fellow app users.

Whether you use Instant Help to get help or provide help, we’re pretty sure that savvy app users like yourself know how to have a good time!

We will be hosting a series of events around New York City where you can meet us in person, exchange ideas on using the app, and frankly just have fun!  Given our app can be used for an unlimited number of things (all legal of course!)  naturally, our meet-ups  will be just as limitless (hey, Brad Cooper, feel free to stop by!). We love movies, sports, dancing, tattoos, sneakers (who doesn't want a gift card to Flight Club!?) and a gazillion other things.  So look out for a LOT of fun pop-up events over the next few months and if you have ideas for an event please feel free to tell us!

We look forward to meeting you both online and in person very soon!

Download the Instant Help App here. 

Cheers! 

- The Instant Help Team

results.description:
We are the North Jersey Chapter of the ASGA (American Singles Golf Association). The ASGA is a National organization comprised of many chapters and thousands of fun people throughout the country. If you are single, enjoy the game of golf, and socializing with a welcoming and great group of people, this is certainly the place to be.

Meet Up is a tool we use to announce scheduled events and to let singles know more about us. We are about promoting the game and engaging people who share a common interest. We invite non-ASGA members to join one of our events. We are very confident that after you participate in one of our events you  will become an ASGA member.  Not only will you be able to participate in local events, you are eligible to sign up  for multi-chapter and nationally scheduled events as well. Several National ASGA events are scheduled through the year which bring you to great golf locations such as, Pinehurst, Ireland, Scotland and yes Hawaii. And, since so many members from all chapters sign up for these events we can offer them to you at virtually unbeatable prices.

 Single golfers from all player levels, beginner to expert, are welcome so join us! If we have convinced you already and you wish to become an ASGA member now please visit our National website at www.singlesgolf.com. The annual dues to join is only $79.00. Sign up for the North Jersey Chapter to begin to take advantage of all that ASGA has to offer. FUN, FELLOWSHIP, AND FAIRWAYS await and we are looking forward to meeting and playing with you and of course enjoying your company at the 19th hole!!!!

Playing a golf round with other singles is simply a great way to spend your time!!!!

NB:  Chapter members sign up for outings through a different venue,  If you wish to attend a GOLF outing you must contact us to ensure there are open slots.  There is no need to pre-contact us to attend social events.
results.name: North Jersey Singles Golf

results.description:
A meetup for community professionals leveraging the power of place!

We are focused on developing a collective for sharing creative and practical topics at the intersection of people, culture, and workplace. We're interested in creating a forum to discuss supporting people and culture through events and environments.

What we're thinking about (and hope you are too!):

•  Physical design and community building: Enriching social environment, soliciting feedback on all elements of work and space to make the full experience the best possible.
• With work becoming more social, what is a workplace but a space in which to grow, support, and incubate a truly productive community?
• Community management, facilities management, people resources, and, technology support are converging in practice. We look to explore the emerging professional impacts.

Some food for thought:

Meet Silicon Valley’s Little Elves
The Perk Bubble Is Growing as Tech Booms Again
The Future of the Community Industry
The Sharing Economy

This Meetup may interest you if your role/team identifies as (though we’re not about titles):

Workplace Services, People Impact, People Happiness Hero, Community Manager, Office Manager, Operations, something else entirely

Your workplace roles may include:

• activating space and community
• organizing events
• curating space management
• connecting members of your organization or workspace ,interdisciplinary - provoking interaction amongst facilities, real estate, human resources, events, administration, marketing, corporate communications, etc.
• being an advocate and ambassador for brand, workplace culture, and people
results.name: Building Community

results.description: New York Persian Cultural Center or NYPC is the first and only Persian Cultural Center in New York City. New Yorkers have been so divers and open minded in exploring new cultures and Persian community in New York have been blending and contributing to the society. NYPC is devoted to facilitate this cultural exchange among our beloved city and community. We are here to strengthen Persian community in New York and add fun, spiritual and meaningful traditions and celebrations to New York society in general. Persian is a broader ethnicity of Iran, Afghanistan and Tajikistan. Each of these countries are well diverse in language and sub-ethnicities like Kurds, Azeries, Hazara, Uzbek, Baluch, Arabs and etc. NYPC teaches languages, cookings and dances. We provide services to New Yorkers such as eBaqali (our online grocery service with free delivery to five borough). We introduce and celebrate with our New York community key events throughout the year. Among them are: winter Solstice (Yalda), Spring Arrival (Norouz, Nowruz), Tirgan (watergun game to celebrate the summer). Please join our social media network (Facebook, Meet-up, Yelp) to stay up to date of our growing events and news.
results.name: Persian Cultural Events in NYC

New York City meetings of Sex Addicts Anonymous offer an accepting, non-threatening environment where we can share our common struggles and learn how to apply the principles of the Twelve Steps to our everyday lives. The only requirement for membership is a desire to stop addictive sexual behavior. There are no fees or dues. It’s a simple program, and it is working for us. We practice strict anonymity and confidentiality, so that our meetings are a safe place for all of us. Learn more about the fellowship going to the NYC SAA Website

I am also running a unique conservation photography initiative where you have the opportunity to contribute directly, through your photography, to nature conservation, and at the same time improve your photography skills. To find out more about this initiative, please visit here.

results.description: This group is to make Charshanbeh Soori a permitted cultural event in New York City, similar to Paris, London, and other great cities. We will advocate for the festivals traditional dances, music, soup, foods and of course the jumping over a bonfire. ‘Chaharshanbeh Soori’ helps shake off the darkness of winter and welcome the lightness of spring, a Persian ritual passed down since ancient Zoroastrian times. Info: The Persian New Year Festival is called Chaharshanbeh Soori, which literally means ‘ Eve of Wednesday’ because the festival is always held on the last Tuesday of winter, just before the Vernal Equinox or first moment of spring. Nowrouz: the first day of Spring and the New Year holiday in Afghanistan, Tajikistan, Azerbaijan, Iran, Pakistan, parts of Russia and India and among the Kurds; comes at the vernal equinox.
results.name: New York's Chaharshanbeh Soori (Fire Festival) Advocates

topics.name: Living with grief after infant/pregnancy loss

results.description:
NOTE:

I'm so sorry to inform you I've decided to close the New York City Infertility & Loss Meetup group. I had great intentions and goals when I decided to form this group, and I'm so sorry to have let anyone down and not followed through on organizing any meetups.

I hope you all have found and continue to find the very needed support this awful infertility and loss struggle requires, and that you are all on the path to healing and wellness.

Again, I'm so sorry to have to close this group.

All the best!!


This is a casual meetup group for women over 40 who are struggling or who have struggled with infertility, and/or loss. Its meant for women who have stopped trying to conceive or infertility treatments and want to share their experiences and find their way to wholeness, and who are questioning their next steps in life, whether that means adoption, surrogacy, or any alternate forms of parenting, or if they are on their way to discovering what life looks like without children. After my own almost 3 year infertility struggle, I've found it hard to connect with other women like myself and hope to find some compassionate and supportive women who want to get together to talk and listen and discover new friendships over drinks, coffee, brunch, dinner or other social activities. I am not a therapist and this group isn't meant to replace therapy, its intended more as a social outlet to connect with others who have had the unfortunate experience of dealing with infertility, and can relate to one another. If you are interested in this group, then my heart goes out to you because I know the pain you've carried. I look forward to connecting and sharing with whoever wants to meet up as part of this group.
results.name: New York City Infertility & Loss Support Group

results.description:
Have you ever wanted to learn a new language but felt overwhelmed only by thinking how much time & effort it will take, so you never started the journey? 

Did you study a foreign language in high school for years and are not able to communicate in that language? 

Would you like to have not only the support of a group with whom you can practice but also the tricks & shortcuts to learning a language fast, naturally & while having fun? 

If you answered YES to any or all of the questions above, then this group is definitely for you.

I decided to start this group because as an international traveler (for both fun & business) I've been so many times in the situation of having to interact with people from different cultures and knowing their language made everything much easier. I also noticed the struggle of other people when it came to language learning & realized I am able to help them. 

I am currently fluent in 4 languages and can easily get by with social and business conversations in 3 others. My secret? A couple of excellent teachers in French and German who made up for all the not so great ones in the other languages & a bunch of friends from different countries.  

The purpose of this group is to create a community of people excited to learn, practice, and have fun together, as these are some of the main rules in language learning: keep practicing while having fun. When the brain and the body are relaxed, the subconscious mind is even more active and takes in much more. 

Here are some of the things we will do: 

Learn, practice & master more and more of what they call “most frequently used words & phrases”. Those are the ones that will break the ice in our learning process, which will liberate us from feeling stuck in a “complicated, almost impossible task”. Besides, we will be a safe environment where mistakes are stepping stones towards mastery of communication. 

Learn to communicate efficiently: - speaking correctly is important, but what most counts is understanding the others and make ourselves understood. Learn to be efficient in communication, not perfectionist in grammar! 

Learn the shortcuts & the tricks: - each language has similarities to another language that you already speak! It can be in terms of word origins, sentence building, grammar, pronunciation or … coincidences!!! Once we know them, our mind will then perceive the process of learning as much easier! Here’s a text in Dutch: “Goede morgen! Mijn naam is Carmen. Ik kom uit Spanien. Ik werk in New York.” I bet you got quite a good idea of what the text is saying. 

I am SO excited to share all these amazing techniques with you and assist you in your journey to becoming a communication master in a new language! 

Carmen
results.name: Have Fun, Make New Friends & Learn a New Language!

results.description:
Like a book club, but for music.

Book clubs are a thing but where are the clubs for people who want to discuss albums or songs, or the latest concert you went to?

Something brought you to this Meetup website, and to this "About Us" page.  Just like you, we LOVE MUSIC.  Deeply.  All kinds of music.  And we get excited meeting and talking with people who love talking about music too.  We want to talk about our favorite bands, and we want to learn about yours and why they are your favorite.  We want to debate over "Best Of..." set lists, decipher and argue different interpretations of song lyrics; talk about jazz, chamber and symphonic music, and all other music without lyrics, (in which case we can decipher what the composers intended to convey through the harmonic and melodic content..., if anything at all - some music might just be absolute, not programmatic, or...who knows, ya know?).  

We love to talk about genres:  Why did the music from the '60 sound the way it did?  Is now a time for a resurgence of protest rock and folk, and if so, why? (What is "protest rock and folk"?  Who were the biggest artists of that movement?)  Did disco really die, or did it get a new set of clothes and producers and come back as EDM?  (What does a "producer" really do, anyway?)  Why do many dance bands today still give honorable mention to Giorgio Moroder and Arif Mardin?  What happened to Neo-Soul?  Dub-Step?  Trap-Step?  Emo?

Why was J.S. Bach's music from the 18th century selected to be among the very finest of what all mankind has to offer, placed in a capsule, and shot into outer space for other lifeforms to hopefully one day discover?  Why did Beethoven, Mozart, and others who came after Bach literally look up to him as "the father of us all in music" (and many textbooks today still regard him as probably the greatest composer ever) when, during his own lifetime his music wasn't considered anything special?  What was the soundtrack of his life?  

What's your favorite film soundtrack?  Does it sound good / bad / funny /scary / tense / dramatic on its own, without the film? (What does it mean when music sounds "scary", or "dramatic"?)  Was it music which had been adapted for the film, or music made specifically for the film?  What other music could have gone with the film in place of that which did?  Would it have made the scenes better?  How? 

The Beatles:  Greatest or Worst band ever?  Why are they still talked about after so many decades?  Would the same have been true for the Rolling Stones if they'd broken up 40 years ago?  For Aerosmith?  Will the Grateful Dead be remembered in 40 years?  Will Michael Jackson?  B.B. King?  Miles Davis? Madonna?  Prince?  Bey (without Jay)?  Miley Cyrus (if she switches to country music in her 30's)?

Which media works best for playing music?  Has anyone tried the Pono player?  The Audioquest Dragonfly?  Do they make digital files sound better than LP records?  (Yes, Bon Iver, Young The Giant, Drake, Jorge Drexler, Passion Pit,...etc. are all available on vinyl LP records).

We could talk about music EVERY DAY FOR THE REST OF OUR LIVES!

COME JOIN US AND BE PART OF THE NARRATIVE!
results.name: Let's Talk Music NYC Meetup

results.description:
Joe Frank:

Joe Frank has been called "Public radio's worst nightmare"  - and over the course of his nearly 40 year career in radio, he has produced 230 hours of shows that have drawn fans by the millions and inspired a generation of producers (Ira Glass of "This American Life" was an early intern for Joe and has cited his work as an inspiration.)


So what exactly does Joe Frank do?

A Joe Frank show is impossible to describe, but spend 5 minutes listening and you'll be drawn into the freeform, philsophical, often humorous world that Joe creates.

Absurdist monologues.... improvised radio dramas... existential philosophy... armchair spirituality... arthouse radio... surrealist tales exploring the human condition........ or as Joe calls his own work: "Radio Noir"

Our Group:

The idea for this group is to get together, turn down the lights, crank up the sound and slowly sip wine (or your beverage of choice) as the aural vibrations of the selected episode gently worm their way into our brains, altering your consciousness... and possibly your worldview.

Each 1 hour show will be followed by mix and mingle time for discussing the audio journey we just experienced.

Examples:

If you are not familiar with Joe's work, here are a few excerpts:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jO1mgTvLfa4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=adDOE1lW6t0

(NOTE: These links have video, but as a rule, Joe Frank episodes are audio-only. We'll be listening to Joe Frank episodes with some trippy lights or something mood-appropriate going.)
results.name: Listening Party Duel: Joe Frank vs Alan Watts

results.description:
Our family of small business groups has over 7,200 members, inside and outside meetup, and still growing!  

We are a community-led organization supported by its members, who range from students reading business books in their dorm rooms, to entrepreneurs looking to become the next  Bill Gates, to investors in search of the next big thing, to top business experts, to established CEOs at some of New York’s top companies.

Enjoy meeting new contacts for networking and/or doing business together. We have experts sharing their knowledge; you will have opportunities to meet with entrepreneurs, start-ups, professionals, investors, angels and venture capitalists. 

We have many functions such as social networking, interactive lectures, discussions, online meetups, brainstorming sessions, round table meetings, think tanks, experts panels and informative educational webinars.

We are not a large group because we put more focus on event quality instead of quantity. The foundation of this group is to support each other in growing and have fun along the way.

Come join us!... Remember in NYC is not what you know, but who you know!

results.description:
Our members are people and  businesses who understand how Free Software can enable and empower indivudals and groups to exploit their own potential.

NYLXS emphasis empowerment, engagement and education through Free Software. See http://www.nylxs.com .  It is a mebership driven organization and it all starts with you.  When you Join NYLXS you become a doer, and learn to take a hands on approach to GNU/Linux and you entire relationship with digital computers.

Regardless of your expertise with Linux and Free Software, members can join any of our actvities including the  Journal Club, Classes, Teaching, Demonstrations, and the Free Software Chamber of Commerce. We encourage active participation.  NYLXS Members are participants in all activities.

From its foundation in late 2001, granted its 501.c status in 2007, its membership driven structure has driven the organization to try experimental, new organizational and educational concepts, much of which has been ground breaking and adopted by other organizations world wide.

NYLXS was the first organization to offer cheap and free detailed classes on the use of free software, Linux and the GNU system for the general public. It has been on the cutting edge in framing Digital Rights issues with the founding of NY Fair Use, and later, the New York Association of Copyright Stake Holders. NYLXS also began a publicly available professional "Inservice Program" in which professionals and researchers in Free Software are given a platform to explain their latest technological research to other professionals, in a peer review process.

NYLXS also created the Free Software Chamber of Commerce, which aligns IT consultants into a joint support group for improved customer services and legal services for individual IT consultants in the New York City area.

We have established a weekly radio show every weekend which is broadcast over the Internet only, as well as a quarterly scholarly journal, and a variety of mailing lists. They've worked with the Department of Education in bringing free software to schools. They have supported education nationally, internationally, and in local government about the availability and advantages of free software, as well advice on public policy which will encourage, and promote free software. They have also focused on education of the public's broad interest in survival of free software.

We meet in Brooklyn and Manhattan, but have reached people all accross the world from Europe to California.  We meet most frequently in Brooklyn and Lower Manhattan.

NYLXS as a non-profit sells no services, and only provides public service.

People come to the Free Software movement for a variety of reasons. Except for the most politically active members among us, the main reason is an attraction to the soundness of the technology and the freedom to access the computer systems we use. Another compelling reason is the economic incentives it can provide disenfranchised individuals as well as large businesses. It's a testimony to our current freedoms that we come to free software without a second thought to the underlining principles that allow for the existence of such systems. In our work promoting free software, we've been surprised how often, even in our own circles, there exists huge resistance to anything political or the least bit distasteful. As a population, we have learned to be skeptical of politicians and stubbornly apolitical.  We loudly promote Free Software by having members participate in teaching, writing, learning, and marketing Freee Software.
results.name: NYLXS - We are Doers
