Code of Conduct:

All attendees, speakers, exhibitors, organizers, contributors and volunteers are required to conform to the following Code of Conduct.

This meetup is for anyone interested in software who can participate in a respectful environment.

Be an adult, don't be a jerk.

We value the participation of each member of the community and want all attendees to have an enjoyable and fulfilling experience. Accordingly, all attendees are expected to show respect and courtesy to other attendees throughout the meet-ups.

We are dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of meet-up participants in any form.

All communication should be appropriate for a professional audience including people of many different backgrounds. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate for any meet-up, including talks.

Be kind to others. Do not insult or put down other attendees. Behave professionally. Remember that harassment and sexist, racist, or exclusionary jokes are not appropriate for our meetup.

Attendees violating these rules may be asked to leave the meet-up at the sole discretion of the organizers.

Thank you for helping make this a welcoming, friendly event for all.

results.description: Hidden in Plain Sight (HIPS) was borne of a desire to foster dialogue between anthropologists and the non-academic world. Social and behavioral science has been used to solve problems for decades in ways that are often hidden, or "white-labeled", and people outside these fields increasingly encounter issues that anthropological perspectives are best positioned to help them understand. As domains like medicine, technology, and marketing face dramatic cultural changes, these counter-corporate points-of-view are coming into the fore in ways that are more influential than ever. HIPS explores the current and future applications of the behavioral and social sciences to solve real-world problems through monthly meetups and online publications. HIPS also serves as a resource for organizations to find researchers and strategists for projects and for social and behavioral scientists to collaborate, fine tune their work, and help drive the changes that industry, academia, and society at large need.
results.name: Hidden in Plain Sight-Tackling Problems with Liberal Arts

results.description:
Our Philosophy:

Our job is to tap ideas that move you to take action. Bond together or ride solo. We want you to share your vision. We want you to open your mind. We want you to be confident. We want you to be you. Our brain tapping experiences are designed to make you feel part of something bigger so you can share what you already know, express it, and turn it into something you will be proud of. After you engage in this crazy collective of expression and encouragement, you will morph into a super-human that everyone will be able to remember.

http://www.remembermegroup.com/

What do we do?

We provide affordable life coaching to students, young-pros, entrepreneurs, and visionaries interested in improving their personal success and business. Really, we would help anyone so hungry to take action  that they are open enough to meet with us for guidance.

What does that mean?

You're about to feel the most excitement you've ever felt in your life. Working with a life coach, you'll have someone asking you all the right questions, shining light on what you want, and help you find strategies that work with your lifestyle to make things possible. Key word - You. Although you can hire us to do some of the work for you, we love to lead the horse to the water so it can drink for life (if you catch our drift). Feel free to ask us what our extra services are!

Are these group meetings?

Guess what - this is anything you want it to be. For the love of networking you'll see us set up brainstorming sessions, but most of our members prefer to schedule a one-on-one meeting to be selfish and talk all about themselves for an hour (which we 100% love and encourage). If you like to pick brains and see how others work, group meet-ups are for you, but if you want to get the most of your meetings, one-on-ones are perfect to hone in on what you want so you can leave with tons of material to work with.

Where do you meet?

Our New York staple is any Think Coffee shop. We've also met at hotel lounges, and other coffee bars. Feel free to share some of your favorite spots to meet. We love shaking it up!

Best part, you can schedule phone calls. Most of our super-humans have jobs and would like to set up a call when it's most convenient for them. This way you make the most of your time, and can handle business at home in your PJ's and easily jump in and out of our meeting.  

What does it cost and how do we pay?

Best $30 you will spend on yourself for an hour of coaching. 

All meetings will be finalized once you pay through Paypal (katiegonzalez@bellsouth.net). 

If we meet in person and you do not have Paypal, cash is accepted.

How effective is this?

One meeting is inspiring. Setting up a month long plan will get you results. Ask us about our challenges.

How do both meetings work?

Meetings are driven to inspire action. We examine what exists, list what needs to be incorporated and improved, plan priorities, and tackle one goal at a time. 

Turning an idea into reality is fun, and we want our clients to feel confident every time we meet. You can think out loud, be messy, find a center and then piece together how you can make things happen. We believe our process will help you achieve great results.

1. Talk

This is your time to be selfish and talk all about all things you and how you want to start developing your vision.

2. Define

Next, we pin-point your priorities based off of what you’ll see instant results from, and work up to the tougher goals you’re intimidated to tackle. We’ll be milking your motivation to make this happen.

3. Brainstorm

Now we get to the fun part and let you purge all the good stuff you’ve been bottling up so we can work together and can come up with a few creative approaches to breathe life into your ideas.

4. Create

Pick a goal date and pull out all the stops to make things happen. We help monitor your performance along the way and recommend tips to handle both your personal and the creative development.

How do we book and pay for a session?

Since it's all about you, pick what time works best with your schedule, pay, and we're set!

https://remembermegroup.acuityscheduling.com/

The end will be the start of something great you created all on your own!

*ICF trained coach. Everything we discuss will be held strictly confidential.
results.name: Remember Me NYC: Business Growth Coaching

results.description:
Most technology meet-ups are loud, boisterous events where presenters present, people mingle with booze, and people like you and me stand against the wall slowly developing a headache. 

We know there are lots of great people to whom those sorts of venues do a disservice.

The goal here is to have a different kind of technology gathering with such goals as: 

* small group discussion 

* problem-solving 

* community & support 

* drinking some damn fine tea and coffee 

This idea is still in a bit of its infancy, but generally it'd be cool if people could bring such diverse discussion topics as: 

* how do I find new freelance clients? 

* how do I avoid race conditions when testing Javascript? 

* what's some great music for intensive work? 

* how can I market my new wizzle-wompus? 

* how do you get noticed in a sea of loud, boisterous people who are slowly getting drunk while you sip your tea? 

We'd pool the ideas people bring, form small groups of 3-4 people who want to discuss an idea, and then maybe share our thoughts with the entire group after some time. Just a place to start. We also need some ideas for venues that have good coffee and tea, some place for a small group to sit, and would be willing to turn the music down for an hour or two.
results.name: NYC Thoughtful Technology Tea Time

results.description:
Please read this completely. This is a Free Guided Meditation Group for those interested in having a group support for there Spiritual Practice and who have an interest in the teachings of the Ascended Masters also know as the I AM Teachings of which Saint Germain is one of the well know Ascended Masters. We will be practicing Meditation techniques for about 20-30 minutes the Practice of the Ascended Master Teachings as well as reading from the different books on the subject with recordings as well as we go throughout this year of meetups, the next one being in September. It will be a very rewarding experience for all. It is known that practicing in a group will greatly enhance our Spiritual experience so Please join us and see. There will be time for Sharing with Questions and Answers. Look forward to meeting you all soon.

Peace & Blessings 


Anthony C. Mirro, CHHC & Mindy B. Pensig, CHHC

Hicksville, NY

results.description:
NYC's only Gender Role-Free Contra Dance. Contra Dance is a traditional American folk dance which requires no prior dance training or experience—if you can walk, you can Contra Dance.

Traditional Contra Dancing is done with "Ladies and Gents" but at Gender Role-Free Dances we dance whichever role we like and with whomever we like. Live music and live calling. Lesson for beginners.

This series has been running for 16 years and is now back in it's original venue at the newly renovated LGBT Community Center on W. 13th St. Beautiful floor, wonderful acoustics, and some of the best callers and bands contra has to offer. Come and join us for a fun night out. Meet new people, get great exercise, and have a blast!

website: www.villagecontra.org; Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/villagecontra/ Our monthly dances are open to everyone, regardless of sexual orientation, gender expression, dance experience or number of left feet.
results.name: NYC Village Contra - Gender Role Free Contra Dance Meetup

results.description:
New Jersey Real Estate Agent Association is an exclusive group built for real estate agents.

What's in it for you:
• Preeminent education
• Valuable networking
• Keynote speakers
• Peer masterminds
• Celebrity and featured guest appearances

New Jersey Real Estate Agent Association, sure to become the biggest and most respected real estate group in the state! Join us with the assurance that you won't be sold, pitched, or harassed. Consider this your path to learning the latest strategies and techniques to increase your bottom line, building a strong network and growing your circle of influence. Come for the education, professional development, and stay for the networking.

The community offers true value by providing reliable resources, useful education and tools, along with live events and unbelievable networking opportunities. The values and core principles which this organization was founded upon are the factors that will drive it to become a success. We hope all of you join us in our continued effort to create a quality real estate community.

Quick FAQs: (1) Who's this group for? Realtors, licensed real estate agents (2) Why should members join? Education, career advancement, personal & professional development, goal-setting, connections, conversation, and more (3) What can members expect out of the group? Timely information about the real estate industry, tactics to generate, convert and close more leads year after year, and the ability to connect with people just like you advancing in their careers (4) What won't be involved in this group? Pitching, selling, nagging and other shenanigans
results.name: New Jersey Real Estate Agent Association

Whether your new in town looking to meet people, or a local looking for something new to explore, Comedy Night at the Duplex is sure to be a hit!

Hope to see you there!

Gina

results.description:
Do you find it's hard to have a spiritual life and a social one? Do you want to learn more about meditation & yoga without feeling inexperienced or judged? This is a group for individuals that enjoy all that city living has to offer and also has a light hearted & free spirited vibe. Discussions include new age concepts such as the Law of Attraction & New Moon Circles as well as stress reduction tools like Meditation & Yoga. All taking place with fabulous like minded individuals in fun locations!

An Urban Gypsy embodies independence and glamour, while also keeping it real with a passion for spirituality and the metaphysical world. Our meet ups promote self satisfaction and good vibes by incorporating meditation, yoga, astrology, self help, and more in fresh and unique ways. We utilize these modalities to create balance & fulfillment in our everyday life!
results.name: Urban Gypsy Community: Kundalini Yoga, Astrology, Meditation

results.description:
"Westchester Women In Business Networking Group"

MACsWomen is a professional, business networking organization founded in Westchester County NY focused on helping business women succeed! We host monthly networking, women in business lunches in Pelham, New York where we encourage qualified, supportive networking and business success strategies. Motivators and Creators Women's Group was created out of a need for business women in Westchester and the New York Metro area to connect, learn and grow profitable businesses. Our elite membership opportunities include free in person monthly women in business networking lunch meetings, professional development and peer to peer online networking and a ton of community benefits. We pride ourselves in attracting a diverse group of smart, professional women from Westchester and the Metro New York area as members of MACsWomen, where we are big on creating a safe, friendly, warm and professional space for women to connect with a main goal to succeed in mind. To view a list of our elite membership benefits and to join us, please go to www.macswomen.com/join
results.name: MACsWomen

results.description: At last, there's a more stylish and sophisticated way to learn the latest facts about sex and intimacy: the Sexual Health Expo (SHE). Set at New York City's stylish Millennium Broadway Hotel, September 19-20, SHE showcases the best from the world of sexual wellness, with appearances and workshops by top sex educators and intimacy experts -- including keynote speaker Dr. Emily Morse, whose Sex With Emily is the top downloaded sex and relationship advice podcast -- and displays and demos of the latest intimacy products. Designed to address the needs and concerns of sexually active adults of all genders and orientations, the two-day event promises to be a groundbreaking, illuminating and welcoming event.
results.name: Sexual Health Expo
